channel.title: NG - Current Release backlog for reporting (Cengage)

item.title: [NG-12805] [Math Processing Error] in Firefox only
item.description:
This happens in Firefox but not Chrome.

Open Uberdoc, Chap 13, Sec 13-2a.
Open Table 4.4 in large table view.
Page right 3 and open Table 8.4 in large table view
Page left 3 and open the last table on the page in large table view.
Notice that row 2 has a Math Processing Error.

See screenshot attached
item.summary: [Math Processing Error] in Firefox only

comments.comment: linking another bug that is in QA Active right now, when fixing please ensure the scenarios in linked defect are not broken as that fix is going through QA testing -

Ben and I got derailed by a bigger bug, but we have a plan of action for this error. In the popout_view.js, we will add something like:
realTable.find('.inlineMath,.math').each(function () {
         var mathML = $(this).find('script').html();
         $(this).html(mathML);
      });

Initial testing is very promising, but needs more attention.
Reviewed by Ron

This ticket's specific scenario is definitely fixed. I am hopeful that NG-12438 is also fixed, but it's hard to tell since it happens more randomly. I will spend some more time trying to verify that one before moving it to QA.
Offshore QA team will check out NG-12438 as well and update -
This issue is no more reproducible at our end. Hence closing this issue.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Firefox was having trouble re-rendering already-rendered mathjax (but only in certain cases)

item.title: [NG-12873] Math: Highlighting Math content "unknown node type error"
item.description:
Navigate to Uberdoc

1. Create Highlights on Chapter 12-1 for example
2. View in note pad all good.
3. In reader navigate to few pages if you can (another bug with navigation)
4. Now select links in notepad and unknown node type error all over, page stretched to the right..all sorts of issues attached.

Note: I have not extended any highlights in this case, simply created some hightlight in a new book.
item.summary: Math: Highlighting Math content "unknown node type error"

comments.comment: I will reopen the related story upon checking on the new build once we get one.
This is seen when navigated via chapter links on TOC as well.
reopened the linked story, hence closing this issue.

item.title: [NG-12884] Regression: Uberdoc: A-head book> TOC is displayed blank for all the sections except section 1 in any chapter
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Launch Uberdoc book with admin credentials and launch section 2-2.
2. Verify that TOC is displayed blank.

Actual Result: Uberdoc: A-head book> TOC is displayed blank for all the sections except section 1 in any chapter

Please refer to the attached screenshot for more detail.
item.summary: Regression: Uberdoc: A-head book> TOC is displayed blank for all the sections except section 1 in any chapter

comments.comment: This is not just Uberdoc happening with all other books built at A-head level- see example for Ehrlich attached.

Linking the 2 fixes if helps ..

around TOC appearing twice, where as here we are loosing the TOC -

Please assign to Nitin once Ready for QA

Hi Nitin,

Please have the team test fix for NG-12884 and update the defect with testing comments.
(Note: this is currently dev complete but build is deployed with this fix checked in, once this is marked Ready for QA we can close it out.)
 

Abhi.
reviewed by ben
Verified this issue on QAE for different books e.g. Ehrlich, Uberdoc and found fixed. Hence closing this issue.

item.title: [NG-12862] (waiting on IE8 testing)Regression: User Annotations: QN and QN on top of HL: Unable to create on pages with apostrophe in the title
item.description:
Discovered failure in the automation test results.

Not in production.

Steps to reproduce on QAE:
1. Log in as any user, launch e.g., IA - Norton 9780495916222 Vol 1 - 11/19/2012 (created Nov 19 8:34 am PDT and not refreshed - giving this info because of the bug NG-12856).
2. Open RA Chapter 16 -> TOC is displayed.
3. Navigate to any page (linearly or click on link from TOC) with apostrophe in the title: b-heads 16-1a, 16-1d, 16-2c, 16-2d, A-head 16-3, etc.
4. Select text and from CM click Add Note (or select text, create HL and click on HL or select existing HL).

Expected result: QN window comes up and a user can create QN.

Actual result: CM does not come up, error

SyntaxError: missing } after property list
http://qae-ng.cengage.com/static/nbreader/ui/apps/nbreader/production.js?v=25
Line 59

Note: maybe not only apostrophe, will continue investigating.
Checked double quotes - work fine.
item.summary: (waiting on IE8 testing)Regression: User Annotations: QN and QN on top of HL: Unable to create on pages with apostrophe in the title

comments.comment: Moving to the MathML team as this bug was likely introduced via NG-12394 or other selection/highlight work being done in 2.5
This seems to be an issue with how white space and breaks are displayed when two highlight spans are together within the glossary and outside. Still not sure why it shows as a space.
Reviewed by Karen

Tested this bug on below browsers 1) QN and QN on top of HL 2) On chapters with and without Apostrophe

Mac/Chrome - PASS
Mac/Safari -PASS
Win7/IE9 - PASS (open bug NG-13006 still exists with margin mark).

item.title: [NG-12905] Regression> FF> Intermittent > Math content missing in the notepad and shows an unknown symbol instead
item.description:
1. Launch Uberdoc,
2. Navigate to chapter 2 > section 2-2a
3. Highlight the text with math content (as shown in the screenshot)
4. Now open the notepad from dock
5. Observe that the match content is missing there and instead it shows an unknown symbol in the notepad.

Note – when open reader and notepad simultaneously and when highlight text in the reader with match content, it seems to work. I do see the math content fine in the notepad. This seems to happen only when open notepad after creating the highlights with math content.

Noticed this issue in ff 16.0.2

comments.comment:
When this symbol on notepad is seen occurring ( happens intermittently ) the next highlight when added you also see the math processing error.
Attached is a screen shot with both the instances seen occurring.
We aren't sure, but are hoping this will be fixed with NG-12903
this seems to be related to timing since it happens intermittently but unable to reproduce anymore. May have been fixed by timing change on mathjax rendering in notepad.

Send a note to Nitin to check on this one on current build, seems like dev, Geetha and Iryna were not able to replicate this one today.

Geetha, to close this out if not reproduced any more by anyone in any browser.
Verified this issue on QAE/QAD across all the browsers and it is not reproducible anymore.
This issue is not reproducible anymore and hence closing this.

item.title: [NG-12920] Regression: CM doesn't shows up on clicking on highlighted text, needs double click/text selection
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch the URL:http://qae-ng.cengage.com/static/nb/ui/admin/masters/masters.html

item.title: [NG-12392] Formulas in Highlights (My Notes) app
item.description:
As a MindTap user, I want to see my highlighted formulas with my highlights in the My Notes app so that I can easily find them

Scenario: a highlighted passage containing text and formulas appears in My Notes with the color that the user selected for that highlight

  • Existing functionality that should also work
    • the chapter/section is listed
    • a snippet of the highlighted text is shown
    • user can collapse/expand entries in the notes
    • follow link from a highlighted formula in My Notes to go to the highlighted formula in the reading activity*

Out of scope scenarios:

  • QuickNote
  • highlighted stand-alone formula
item.summary: Formulas in Highlights (My Notes) app

comments.comment: Review by Ron

Cannot be demoed in QAE till NG-12394 is completed.
To demo it to QA localy, update "user_annotations" collection in mongo to have some math content.

Reopening this story, contact QA if questions on reproducing the issue.

highlights appear ok on notepad but on the latest build when you select the links from the notepad "unknown node type" error over math - see steps to reproduce below:

Navigate to Uberdoc
1. Create Highlights on Chapter 12-1 for example
2. View in note pad all good.
3. In reader navigate to few pages if you can (another bug with navigation)
4. Now select links in notepad and unknown node type error all over, page stretched to the right..all sorts of issues attached.
Note: I have not extended any highlights in this case, simply created some hightlight in a new book.
see linked defect for screenshots only. Closing this defect as I have reopened the story now after confirming on latest build that this is related to the story.

Another scenario that needs to be tested as well - Navigate from notepad to reader page with math HL's
Example:
1. Open the book and launch any RA.
2. Open the notepad and using the link navigate to the HL with math content from notepad to the reader.

Reader page should open up without any issues. Currently this doesn't seem to work as expected for which the bug NG-12904 is filed.

Note to Dev - Tester

Before moving this story to QA, please review all the linked issues in IE and non - IE browsers to ensure everything is functional.
Move this story to QA once the following stories are completed: NG-12903, NG-12904, NG-12905, NG-12910, NG-12872.

For Math use Uberdoc - all browsers except IE8.

item.title: [NG-13053] Regression: Displaying "Math Processing Error" on reader when navigated from notepad
item.description:
Tested on FF and Chrome - happens on both the browsers (expected to see the same in all the browsers).

Steps to reproduce:
1) Login into QAE and launch uberdoc.
2) Create couple of HL without math, Ex: non-math from chapter 2
3) Create couple HL's With math from a different chapter
Ex: math from chapter 13.
3)With reader open, via notepad navigate to non-math HL(navigates correctly to the page on reader).
4) Now scroll down to math HL on the notepad and using the 'goto' link navigate to HL on the reader (reader may not be pointing to target location on the page-scroll to find the HL).

Actual result: Math processing error seen on reader
Expected result: Math with HL is seen.
item.summary: Regression: Displaying "Math Processing Error" on reader when navigated from notepad

comments.comment:
We are now able to reproduce this consistently on QAE and QAD with the below steps:

Login in QAE/QAD and launch uberdoc
1)Create a HL on math Example: 12-3 formula in the 1st paragraph
2)open the NP to check
3) go to the reader change color of the HL
4) after color change immediately change the RA on reader
5) go to NP and use the link to navigate to reader

Actual: MATH PROCESSING ERROR seen on reader

Note: Able to reproduce in new and existing book on QAE /QAD

I have not been able to reproduce this since NG-13094 was fixed. I tried in Chrome, FF, and IE9.

13094 involved multiple math controllers being attached to the same content - I suspect that fixing that corrected the "Math Processing Error" as well as the "blank math" error.
Re-Tested this issue on QAE/QAD and it is not reproducible at our end.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Fixed with NG-13094

item.title: [NG-12904] Regression: Math HL: navigation from notepad to Reader has issues opening the RA or displaying math on the reader intermittently
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

Use an existing book with HL containing math with text and only text.
OR
Create a new book and put in a bunch of HL having math with text and only text.
Note: I had atleast 10-12 HL created with few HL spanning on entire page containing math with text.

Case i) RA not launching but displays spinner rotating.
1)Open the book and launch any RA.
2) Open the notepad and using the link navigate to the HL with math content from notepad to the reader.
Actual result: RA doesnt launch but the rotating spinner is displayed.
Expected result: Ra should bring up the page with the HL.
Note: Trial it few times if not reproducible in the 1st attempt.

Case ii) Math content in the RA intermittently displays as normal text instead of math.
1)Open the book and launch any RA.
2)Open the notepad and using the link navigate to the HL from notepad to the reader. Keep switching the HL's and navigate to the reader page continuously.
3) At one point you will hit a scenario where the Reader displays math content as normal text and not as MATHML.
item.summary: Regression: Math HL: navigation from notepad to Reader has issues opening the RA or displaying math on the reader intermittently

comments.comment:
I am also seeing the issue described in Case i) in ie9 RA not launching but displays a blank black board.

In ie9 when opening the notepad and using the link to navigate to the HL with math content from notepad to the reader, user sees blank black board instead of the reader page (pl see the attached ie9.png).

Note - This happens only when there is math content in the HL. Plain highlighted text seems to work and reader opens up fine when navigate from notepad to reader.

Error in Console:
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined /static/nbreader/ui/apps/nbreader/production.js?v=49:8
This could be related to NG-12395. I suggest we block this until NG-12395 is done.
After the discussion with developer, adding a video to the case 2 scenario as these are seen intermittent.
Adding a video for case 1 too as this is also an intermittent issue.

We found an issue with links from the Notes App back to the Reader. Upon fixing it, we couldn't reproduce case 1 or case 2. Hopefully this resolves both problems.

Note: The reader does not scroll to the selected text. There is an existing production bug NG-7927 for this.
Reviewed by Sajid

Please have someone retest this on QAE -
*IE8 not supported for Math.
* If looks good not reproduced close.
* If still able to reproduce then assign to the reporter and please update with comments as usual.
Verify this issue on QAE environment and found that navigation is not working for IE-9 browser from Notepad to reader page
making this unassigned for dev to check further

Assigning this bug to Soumya for further testing.
There might be a specific scenario were this is not working but straight forward case was able to select the links from notepad and reader launched fine.
This is reproducable -- reopening...

NOTE:
1)Tested on all the browsers, now the NP to Reader navigation for HL issue exists ONLY on IE9 & IE8 (For IE8 checked on non-math content HL)
2) Issue reproducible on IE9 for math and non-math books

Navigation from Notepad to Reader - Steps to Reproduce:
1) Create multiple highlights in the same chapter - ex. chapter 2 , 2.2a on uberdoc
2) With chapter 2 (any section or on 2.2a) open in the reader, open the notepad and try to navigate from NP to reader via HL goto link. WORKS
3) Now, via LPN go to another chapter ex. 12.
4) Open the notepad and using the goto link on the NP for the HL navigate to the reader - DOES NOT WORK.
This is now consistent behavior not intermitten and see the linked defect.
soumya to check if this is still reproducable.

Re-tested this bug in IE8 and IE9 and the navigation links from NP to reader are working.
Looks the linked bug fix for NG-13084 which had NP links across browsers issue fixed this one as well.

As this has been validated to work - closing out this bug.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: There was code in lpn.js that was supposed to fix this problem, but it wasn't working.

item.title: [NG-12903] MathML: Notepad: [Math Processing Error] when open Notepad after creating any Highlights
item.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch Uberdoc, open Chapter 12.
2. On any page with MathML select text+formula+text and create HL -> displayed on the page (in the screen shot the following HL were created: text+block formula+text in yellow and green colors, text+inline formula+text in blue).
3. Open Notepad and confirm HLs are properly displayed.
4. Close Notepad.
5. Select any text and create HL (plain text in pink color).
6. Open Notepad and observe HL created to text+formula+text.

Expected result: text and formula are displayed in Notepad properly.

Actual result: [Math Processing Error] instead of formula in some places in Notepad.

Note: keep Notepad open and create any HL -> formulas appear and are displayed correctly in Notepad.
item.summary: MathML: Notepad: [Math Processing Error] when open Notepad after creating any Highlights

comments.comment: Currently cannot verify due to the issue with highlighting MathML (incorrect/extended highlights are displayed on the page).

I reviewed this initially, and found it to be fixed. However now that we've got selected math displaying correctly, Ravish and I re-tested it. We found that on IE9, it will break in the following way:
- select some math
- review it in the Highlights App
- hide the Highlights App
- select something else on the page (making the hidden app re-render itself)
- show the Highlights App
=> you will now see large areas of white space all around the selected math, because it was rendering math while it was hidden.
On IE9 there is a blank space with background color instead of error - see attached screenshot.
Reviewed by Karen
checked on Chrome, FF, IE9 both the issues noted in the bug are no longer reproduced - closing.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Mathjax svg is not rendered properly when hidden in firefox

item.title: [NG-12910] inlineMath: Annotations: Notepad: inlineMath is not displayed in Notepad
item.description:
Not in production (please see the last screen shot).

Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch Uberdoc, open Chapter 1, navigate to section 1.2.
2. Inspect math elements within Concept Check 7.2 (note: this is not MathML).
3. Select text+inlineMath+text (easy to see the issue) and create Annotations (HL or QN) -> Annotations are displayed on the page.
4. Open Notepad.

Expected result: text+inlineMath+text is displayed in Notepad.

Actual result: inlineMath is not displayed in Notepad.
item.summary: inlineMath: Annotations: Notepad: inlineMath is not displayed in Notepad

comments.comment:
This is not a "math" issue, it is an annotation one.
When we try to highlight across multiple <li> elements, the selection logic is finding the text of only some of the parts.
I suggest that one of the "annotation re-write" team look at this.
Notice that the span has the inlineMath class, but it does not contain any MathML it's just text

Updated code that recognizes mathML elements to not include math elements that have no mathML within them. This lets the code treat the text within those elements the same as other text in the reader.

Tested in :

QAE:

Mac/FF - PASS
Mac/Chrome - PASS
Mac/Safari - PASS

Works on Win 7 - FF/chrome/IE9 too.

IE8 is blocked due to NG-12952
? Do we need this on IE8
Works on IE8 as well. Closing this out.

attachment.name: Production_creating HL to inlinrMath is ok.png
attachment.author: iabukhou

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: content had some inlineMath and math elements that had not mathML within them which was not a known requirement

item.title: [NG-12911] MathML: Annotations: Creating Annotations to some MathML elements makes them disappear from the page
item.description:
In production as well but not logging as production bug because annotations to mahtml stories are being played in 2.5.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch Uberdoc, open Chapter 13, navigate to 13-4, scroll to the last paragraph.
2. Make selection including "delta" and create Highlights (same is for QN though not played yet).

Expected result: text is not changing upon creating Annotations.

Actual result: "delta" disappears.

Note: same disappearing issue is in 13-3: create Highlights to selection text+MathML+text and confirm not all MathML symbols are displayed (note: there are more of them than it is in the screen shot).
item.summary: MathML: Annotations: Creating Annotations to some MathML elements makes them disappear from the page

comments.comment:
For the disappearing characters, mathJax generates them as <text> elements inside the <svg> element.
Our annotation logic finds these text elements and puts a <span> around their contents, which is not valid, the span should not be inside any svg element.
The solution to this could be related to NG-12872
This was fixed by the fix for NG-12872
Reviewed and confirmed by Karen
Can we get this verified across all browsers except IE8? thank you.
Verified this issue on QAE environment across all the browsers and found it to be fixed hence we closed this ticket

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: this was caused by our highlight solution putting span tags inside the svg text nodes

item.title: [NG-13033] Manually added RA does not display Math on the LPN
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

Login as an Admin:

  • Navigate to the Uberdoc 9781133314677 and Add a new Reading.
  • Select option to Add entire chapter which has Math and SAVE.
    (Adding Readings at A-head or B-head work fine.)

Result: Math renders as plain text on the LPN
Expected: Math should display as Math.

Note: TOC and Chapter Titles are displayed correct in this case, see linked stories.
item.summary: Manually added RA does not display Math on the LPN

comments.comment:
When I tried this, the math doesn't render in the "select activity" dialog either. Is it supposed to? Is this another bug? (I thought I remembered it being another bug...)

Anyway when you refresh the book, the math starts displaying in the LPN. Possible workaround.
Hi Karen, Activity Manager stories we have not played yet for Math.

Hi Nitin, I reviewed this with dev looked good but please have someone test this out in the new builds.

Close if this looks good to you.
Verified Manually added RA on the LPN on QAE environment and found that issue is still reproducible as it doesn't display as Math on LPN. Hence Reopening this issue.

Hi Pravendra, can you please provide me the example of which activity you added? I tried few and they seem to show Math ok.

Add details on what type of book etc so I can followup..

Hello Abhilasha,

I have added "Part Overview h(x)=x2−1" reading activity manually and it is displayed as plain text <<actual.jpg>>.

item.title: [NG-12395] Highlighted selection containing text and formulas remains highlighted after page reload
item.description:
As a MindTap user, I want to highlight a segment of a reading activity that contains text and formulas so that I can easily find it later in a quick glance at the page

Proposed user experience (open to improvement): identical to highlighting text; when I click and drag over text, the text and any formulas are selected; then a context menu appears with the option to highlight.

Background: this is support for a single limited use case of selection, which is a selection that begins with text, ends with text, and contains one or more formulas

Scenario: highlight persists on page refresh

Scenario: highlight persists on navigating to the next page and then back to the page containing the highlight

Scenario: highlight persists on navigating to the previous page and then back to the page containing the highlight

Scenario: highlight persists on navigating to away to another chapter and then back to the page containing the highlight

Note: be sure to test IE9, because it is currently not working

other acceptance criteria

  • Make sure highlight is done with the same color as selected originally
  • test both single page navigation and multiple pages in same chapter (caching)
item.summary: Highlighted selection containing text and formulas remains highlighted after page reload

item.title: [NG-12827] Highlighted Math content should show with highlight color as background
item.description:
As a MindTap user, I want to highlight a segment of a reading activity that contains text and formulas and have both the text and the formulas change color

Acceptance Criteria

select plain text that has one or more math objects within it (text does not overlap other html elements)
contextual menu appears with add highlight func
click add highlight with any color
should show highlight color on text within selection
should show highlight color on math object within selection

Accepted limitations:

  • User experience: formulas may not have a “selected” appearance during the act of selection; background color may only be applied to formulas after the mouse is released
  • The selection cannot start with a formula
  • The selection cannot end with a formula
  • Highlights may not persist or display properly on page refresh or on navigating to another chapter and then navigating back to the highlight. This is a separate story: NG-12395
  • No support for highlighting formulas in a table or an image caption
  • No support for QuickNotes (separate story)
  • Formulas in the highlight may not display properly in the Highlights app. This is a separate story: NG-12392.

will this support change highlight color? We have story NG-12712 in case it does not. But if it comes for free,we should note that for testing.
item.summary: Highlighted Math content should show with highlight color as background

item.title: [NG-12856] (Blocked by NG-12949)Regression: Reader Navigation left to right loads redundant pages
item.description:
This has been caught in automation tests as well as reproduced manually.
Steps to reproduce are still not clear - will update when we get to them.

1) When we hit this scenario, reader navigation from left to right loads the TOC and chapter introduction (need not be always TOC and chapter introduction, happens with 1st two pages on that RA)pages twice. At this point when we navigate from right to left we hit a blank page. Attached is the video and errors captured in Console.

2) The session we hit this scenario , we would continue to see this happening only any chapter launch from LPN.
item.summary: (Blocked by NG-12949)Regression: Reader Navigation left to right loads redundant pages

comments.comment: Characterizing further to understand the scenario when we hit this issue. We have noted this happening in a newly created book as well.
The same navigation problem is in Master (and its snapshots) Norton Vol 2 Core 9780495916239/SSO 9781133353720 on QAD (refreshed 11/19).

Note that when user hits the Reader Navigation problem then highlighted text does not show up properly in the reader (sometimes). Seems like the highlight is created because when you navigate back and forth few times it displays -
Intermittently when we hit the blank screen , we also see that the navigation is completely stopped. Navigation via LPN, chapter contents - none works.
Change the severity of this bug to High - as the workaround seems to work sometimes and user can proceed with navigation, but at times navigation totally stops as noted by Soumya earlier.

See attached videos when a user is stuck on using sidebar navigation both previous and next do not work, only way to view chapter is via chapter contents link get to the TOC page and then click on particular a -head or b-head.

Above scenario happened with a newly created master and then launching a RA in that master, we have seen this in some other books as well where sidebar navigation stops working. (Intermitten issue around this same bug)

Let us know if navigation issue needs to be broken down into different bug, this was also original observations when user hits the redundant pages this was one of the outcome, hence the priority high.

Ben and I found 2 problems when analyzing this, both introduced by NG-10791:
1) newly added "chapter" master gets a duplicate TOC added to the beginning. This caused blank screen and navigation problems.
2) newly added "ahead" master (for uber) fails, so when you access it the LPN is empty.

We fixed both of the above issues and checked it in to master. This should un-block QA. However we found additional problems with the "ahead" uber TOC pages. For example Chapter 2 "end of chapter" material has a blank TOC. This needs more analysis, and I recommend opening a new bug for it, since it's a completely different problem. The root problem is still changes from NG-10791. We did not realize the same code was being used when creating new ahead masters, so it will need more work.
Verified this issue on QAE environment across the browsers and found no more reproducible as Redundant pages are not displayed while navigating through reader

This issue is still reproducible in certain Uberdoc and non-uberdoc existing books.
Ex: In QAD
STQA_Mathmlrem
MyTestthanksgiving


Also, if the existing books are refreshed - the problem is not seen.

Discussed with Developers on this and this seems to be as expected:

[11/26/12 2:56:59 PM] Soumya T: 1) New book - Issue not seen
[11/26/12 3:00:08 PM] Soumya T: 2) Existing certain recent books(created last week) - Like on QAD - book STQA_Mathmlrem - navigation problem is seen easily reproducible

[11/26/12 3:20:54 PM] Ben Livermore: it seems that behavior two is the bug that was introduced in 2.5 and that we tried to fix. It also seems likely that the persistance of this bug in books created recently is due to faulty data introduced by the original bug. This data should only be faulty in environments that had the bug and should always be fixed by a refresh.
[11/26/12 3:22:35 PM] Karen: i agree with ben's assessment: books that were created while the bug was in qa will always be broken
[11/26/12 3:23:18 PM] Karen: as long as there are no issues with books created before the bug went in, and books created after the bug was fixed, we should be okay

Checked couple of existing books from before the issue was introduced and after the fix was made - navigation looks good.

This is readily reproducible with manually added reading activity.

Steps:
Add a reading activity manually under any unit or at the top level
Launch the reading TOC page, navigate via forward arrow and comeback using the previous arrow, Observe that the linear navigation loads duplicate TOC page.
We are not able to reproduce this issue on already created reading activity, however this issue is reproducible only for manually created reading activity on QAE/QAD environment.
Can't be tested until NG-12949 is fixed.

Hi Nitin, please assign this to someone in the team to verify.

NG-12949 is now resolved also so this should be testable.
As usual, testing should cover browsers and defect to be updated with testing comments.
Verified this issue on QAE environment and found it to be fixed for all the browser except IE-8 blocked by NG-13020 this , after fixing this we may close this ticket
Moving it to QA again as this is now only applicable for IE8 - once the blocking defect on IE8 is resolved this can be retested.

item.title: [NG-11446] Client Side Prevention of Save of WC into Master when Reader/Media refresh errors
item.description:
See: https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/NG-11446+Client+Side+Prevention+of+Save+of+WC+into+Master+when+Reader+Media+has+refresh+errors

GIVEN a content refresh error has occurred in a working copy
OR media metadata error has occurred in a working copy
WHEN a production or editor user is looking at working copy in list
THEN the system will disable the save button
AND the system will present an error message to the user
BUT for Superadmin save button will be enabled

acceptance criteria

  • for all published Master MTs (reader and CM):
  • for Production and Editor users:
  • prevent a save of a Working copy into a master MT when a reader content or media metadata refresh errors exists
    • The Save Button will be disabled when either or both of these refresh errors exist
    • the existing Refresh error warning banner that is visible in the Working Copy UI will change to read:
      Refresh errors may have corrupted your Working Copy. MindTap cannot save it to the Master. You can attempt another Refresh or delete the Working Copy and start again.
  • for Superadmin users ONLY
    • when a Content or Media Metadata refresh error occurs and the user clicks the Save button (Save button is NOT disabled), a Confirmation dialog will be presented to the user:
      Your Working Copy may be corrupted. Review your Working Copy before saving to the Master. Do you still want to save?

TESTING NOTE allow save of working copy back to Master if there are product metadata or book cover refresh issues for all users - there is no change required here. this is the existing functionality. This is noted for testing purposes.
Updated Messaging:
Your Working Copy may contain non-critical errors. Do you still want to save to the Master?

(AC changed from - The existing messaging/banner will be be maintained for this case.)
Note, that I am okay if the existing message is kept. carrie
item.summary: Client Side Prevention of Save of WC into Master when Reader/Media refresh errors

comments.comment: This story will include shoring up the brittle code noted in NG-11325. This bug should be fixed with the implementation of this story. Dev and QA should verify that this bug is addressed
https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/NG-11446+Client+Side+Prevention+of+Save+of+WC+into+Master+when+Reader-Media+refresh+errors
this story should include a code refactor of the refresh update logic. Talk to Brad and Ron about what work has already been done.

I am unfortunately unable to find any trace of the code that Brad and I did. The file nb/ui/admin/list/list.js has a controller that was intended to be a generic list for the admin page, but contains a lot of masters specific logic that needs to come out and brought into a subclass of the admin list controller. That is where we started. Once that's done ,the ping function can come out of the admin list and into the masters page. There is also an ejs file that has quite a bit of logic in it for permissions. If I recall correctly, there was a server side change that we were wanting for the masters model which would bring back information about actions available to the user.

It's been a while since I worked on any of this, so my memory is fuzzy, but I will be more than happy to work closely with this issue if necessary.

Test scenarios to be followed on this story are captured in the below location:

https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/NG-11446+Client+Side+Prevention+of+Save+of+WC+into+Master+when+Reader+Media+has+refresh+errors

All the test scenarios are good and worked well for - new and existing, CM and RM MT's and all the roles.

With wordings we have seen one issue -
* for Production and Editor users:

** when save is disabled - the existing Refresh error warning banner that is visible in the Working Copy UI will change to read:
Refresh errors may have corrupted your Working Copy. MindTap cannot save it to the Master. You can attempt another Refresh or delete the Working Copy and start again.

This above message is not seen.
The refresh banner message still doesnt reflect the right one, attaching the screenshot.

Re-tested all the test case scenarios after the fix of bugs NG-13115, NG-13116 - Everything works good.
Bug - NG-13127 has been created and linked. Once that is fixed will pass the story.

Bug with the message is fixed and closed out.

Carrie - Sending this over to you for final review.

item.title: [NG-11447] Server Side prevention of Save of WC into Master when Content/Media Refresh Errors
item.description:
GIVEN a content refresh error has occurred in a working copy
OR media metadata error has occurred in a working copy
WHEN a Production or Editor user attempts to merge the working copy to master
THEN the system will query the state of refresh error for the working copy
AND the system will prevent the wc save into Master

acceptance criteria

  • for all published Master MTs (reader and CM):
  • for Production and Editor users ONLY
  • when a Content or Media Metadata refresh error occurs, the server will prevent a Working Copy save into Master
    • this must be testable by QA either by a database query or other method to verify

TESTING NOTE For superadmin users there will be no changes to server side working copy save functionality.

for production and editor users, allow save of working copy save if there are product metadata or book cover refresh issues for all users (there is no change required here. this is the existing functionality.
item.summary: Server Side prevention of Save of WC into Master when Content/Media Refresh Errors

comments.comment: Started working on this with Ben, but got pulled into some other higher priority stuff. So moving it back to READY column.
Both NG-11447 and NG-11446 will be tested by me and Soumya based on test scenarios documented on wiki.

As suggested by Ron during story review steps to set the error states:

* Get the component status for a snapshot
select * from SNAPSHOT_COMPONENT_STATUS
WHERE SNAPSHOT_ID = 15121

* Set the Component Status to error state
update COMPONENT_STATUS set STATUS=3, ERROR_TEXT='ERR' WHERE ID= 42082
update SNAPSHOT set STATUS=2 WHERE ID=15121;

* Set back to original state
update COMPONENT_STATUS set STATUS=2, ERROR_TEXT=NULL WHERE ID= 42082;
update SNAPSHOT set STATUS=NULL WHERE ID=15121;

Testing Results:

 Setup error in all 3 types of Refresh states - see attached screenshot comparing a Superadmin Role and a Production Role.
-- SuperAdmin has SAVE enabled ok.
-- Production user has SAVE disabled, so they will not be able to proceed with the product metadata refresh until others are cleared, acceptable? If yes then the message they see applies to 2 reader or media not the metadata.

Feedback from Carrie: This is acceptable, in above scenario when the product metadata fails with other failures Production users will need to contact SuperAdmin to continue with product metadata refresh.

Looks good - see testing comments and additional testing on client side storiy NG-11446


* Checked with each individual type or error states for superadmin and production/editor roles.
* Ensured Production and Editor roles can continue with Product metadata refresh if there are errors.
* Ensured Production and Editor users are prevented from SAVE of WC when there are content and media errors.
* Ensured Superadmin can bypass all errors and SAVE wc to a master after the warning.

item.title: [NG-12335] Branding: Phase 2- Core Text Name and Edition for Snapshot to come from the Master, from the Product Metadata Service
item.description:
as a user, I want the core text name and edition to be the same in the Master and the snapshot so there are no differences during CCC review

Background
The coretext title and edition are pulled from different locations for Master vs. Snapshot. THis was primarily to have the Snapshot's MT title on splash page match what is seen by users on Cengage Brain. Since Branding Phase 2 removes the MT title and uses discipline and references the core text title and edition, this distinction is no longer necessary

Acceptance criteria

  • For Master and Snapshot ReaderMode MT's only, the info on the LP title will pull from the Geyser product metadata service the book title and edition
  • For all MT's, the Full Book will pull the book title and edition from what is pulled via the Geyser product metadata service
  • this should also change the book title/edition on the splash page for snapshots
  • for all CM and RM Master and Snapshot MT's, in any book reading activity (RA from the coretext, not a non-book reading activity)
    • from what is pulled via the from the Geyser product metadata service display the Title and edition in the pop-up
  • verify that the title and edition in these 3 locations match between Master and snapshot, for new and existing snapshots
    data migration required

item.title: [NG-12795] Reader/Full book launches blank intially for some users, until Cache is cleared, observed on mostly Chrome but also IE 8/9
item.description:
Noticed so far by QA and Internal User

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch a course via SSO/Cengage brain on a Chrome (UNCLEARED CACHE) browser as instructor or student.
2. Navigate to any RA via the LPN or launch the RA via full book.

Actual result: RA activity is blank in reader and full book
Expected result: RA activity to be launched in reader and full book.

Workaround : Once the browser's cache is cleared, RA launches fine on reader and full book.

Note:
1.Observed on Chrome only so far
2.Instructor/Student accounts used were by internal users.
3.Happens Intermittently only - NOT always reproducible.
4. Internal User did have slow internet connection though it worked fine after clearing the cache on the browser.

Attached are the errors seen on console and network calls as well as the screenshot of the MT.
item.summary: Reader/Full book launches blank intially for some users, until Cache is cleared, observed on mostly Chrome but also IE 8/9

comments.comment:
As noted in the title above, this is happening with only some users
We tried 7 or 8 machines here and were not able to reproduce
But so far 3 users have certainly reported the problem and we have witnessed the problem.

and learned from Jared Mann,
Customer Support has reports of few more people experiencing this problem coming via Aplia is one example.

After spending the afternoon researching it with several people, we have the following information gathered:

We were able to reproduce the error on John Nader's laptop. He got the problem looking at a chapter he'd been looking at yesterday.
The issue on Cindy's machine looks somewhat different, so it may or may not be related to this issue.
The js version with today's release (2.4) is 11, while the js version from yesterday (2.3) is 161.
The error seems to involve caching of the html and the javascript.

John:
Specifically, this URL: http://ng.cengage.com/static/nbreader/ui/apps/nbreader/nbreader.html#!&tocId=502c52d920b333b12899d366 is loaded from my cache, and the content inside the URL has this lable: var buildTag = "jenkins-ng-ui_MASTER_PACKAGE_PUBLISH-161"

Karen:
The html should not have been cached. If it wasn't cached, it would have looked for js version 11. Instead it's looking for js version 161.
John confirmed that all nodes have the same production.js, the version 11.
Steve Clayton was spending some time looking at apache configs, trying to see why the htmls might be caching (they aren't supposed to be allowed to cache)
One interesting thing we found is that john's laptop got better when he started navigating to different chapters (via aplia)
He did NOT clear his cache, but the error no longer happens on his laptop
I wonder if this explains why we haven't gotten more reports of the problem....?
Our working theory is that maybe by going to a different chapter, he hit a link that the browser hadn't cached.  once that happened, everything cleared up.

John:
We thing we've got a way to approxmate how often this is happening in production.  We counted the occurances retrieving production.js?v=161.
We see about 30 occurances today, many of which were our own recreations of the issue.
We are not seeing the occurances getting worse.
This is comared to about 15,000 retrivals of production.js?v=11, which is the correct version
Yes we'd like to understand why some users are experiencing this, but it may be less than 1% of the users impacted.
We do want to identify root cause to this caching issue, but would like to get a priority call over the other work we stopped doing to look into this.

We're still seeing it periodically in production this morning (Friday 11/16). 6 hits out of ~2200 that hit the correct production.js (< .5%).

Still worth investigating to see if we can isolate root cause

I'm not sure what the root cause of this issue is, but we're going to try changing the Apache settings to see if we can avoid this in the future. As a precaution, we are going to add an additional cache control header to HTTP responses. This header has been tested with Chrome, and it has been found to force Chrome to pull pages from the server. I propose we monitor this situation during the next release to see if this header has had an effect.

I thought the issue may have been our unconventional use of the Expires HTTP header. We use a number for this field (-1) when it should really be a date. During my testing, it appears that Chrome doesn't understand the -1. That is, it appears to cache things even though we have given it an Expires header.

However, the production logs don't totally support this theory. If Chrome was respecting the expiration headers, we would expect to see many server hits for the HTML pages in question. Unfortunately, the picture painted by the server is unclear: we do witness server hits for these pages through Chrome, but not in the same proportion as other browsers. It is still reasonable to conclude that we aren't controlling the cache as effectively on Chrome as we are on the other browsers.

Here are some other theories that we considered but have ruled out:
1. Browser versions: There is no particular Chrome version that seems to be a particular problem. We've witnessed some problematic versions working fine for most everyone else.
2. Intermediate caches: it's possible that some users are accessing through a a proxy that only understands the Http 1.0 protocol. However, if this was the root cause, then we would expect the problem to have occurred for other browsers besides Chrome.

Changes have been applied to the QA environments, and they appear to be active. Supposedly, Jared will be rolling this out to production soon. Once rolled out, it will be interesting to see whether this problem goes away or is at least reduced overtime. It probably won't go away completely, as there are users out there who have stale files within their cache. (I think Chrome caches the headers too, so they won't necessarily see our latest header changes.)

Verified on QAE and QAD without clearing the cache - launching through Cbrain and Fulfillment URL using Student/Instructor Roles, I am not experiencing any Blank reader pages on Fullbook and Reader side.

Closing for now!

- Vinay

item.title: [NG-12333] UX: Update Splash Page for Branding part 2
item.description:
as a user I want to see the brand of the MT on the splash page and in the MT header so I can easily recognize the discipline,where applicable.

Acceptance Criteria

  • ReaderMode MindTaps:
    • will not have Discipline nor have any prefix(Featuring/Selections) added to the author, title and edition
    • will not have the MT name appear in Orange in either a Master or Snapshot
  • for both reader mode and coursemode, both Master and Snapshots: the copyright information for both the CoreText and MindTap has been moved to the bottom left of the splash page
  • for Coursemode MT's only, in Master and Snapshots: the discipline name will be added to the splash page next to the MT logo and in the MT header (top left)
    • the MT name (in orange) will be removed
    • the discipline name will come from the Geyser product search rest service
    • the discipline color will be hard coded according to the Discipline Color Palette (see attached)

Note: The "Featuring" and "Selections from" syntax will NOT be added to the MT splash page to differentiate regular CM MT's from C360 MT's at this time.

  • after this is implemented,a Product Metadata refresh Option needs to be done for all CM MT titles to get the discipline to display
    • need to create config ticket to schedule this

item.title: [NG-12438] Math: NON IE8 browsers: Math processing message in Math content display on LPN and Reader
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

CASE A:
Launch Uberdoc in master or develop builds.
1. From LPN select Chapter 13 RA and navigate to 13-2
2. Scroll to find the image and below there is some Math text and notice the Math Processing error on one of them.

Right click to see Math rendering option present - See screenshot attached.

Note: I did see this on the LPN in last release once but was not able to reproduce this one is consistent.

CASE B:

  • Launch Uberdoc and navigate to table with math content (12-1, scroll to the bottom) and select option to enlarge – see same Math processing error. (See attached screenshot)
  • Relaunch or resize and looks good.

CASE C:
When browser or performance is slow you will see this error, see new attached screenshot with LPN display.
item.environment:
QAD - develop branch
QAF - master branch
item.summary: Math: NON IE8 browsers: Math processing message in Math content display on LPN and Reader

comments.comment:
Hi Emily,

Can you please review this and let us know if the content is correct for Math here, as we see Math Processing Error message.

From MathJax 2.1 release notes: "Fixed a problem with <mmultiscripts> in SVG mode that caused processing error messages."

See also: https://github.com/mathjax/MathJax/issues/294
That appears to be the bug that was fixed in MathJax 2.1, which looks like what we are experiencing here.

Text in 13-2 is testing the <mmultiscripts> tag which is currently not supported by MathJax - that's why you're getting the error. Content is fine.

Not sure about table in 12-1, but since the content renders correctly in some cases, I don't think it's a content issue.
Fix for this is blocked until we update the MathJax library
<mmultiscripts> seems to be working fine after the upgrade to MathJax 2.1
dev work was just checking that math rendered properly in the places noted in the bug. this was really fixed by upgrading to MathJax 2.1 (NG-12340)

Reopening this defect - see latest screenshot attached from FF version.
* Also, note Dick's comment on this bug there was no fix made to fix this specific issue except the MathJax version updated, so when I saw new bug opened made me think this might be still broken and it is, so new bug seems to be similar to this issue as far as I can tell.
* Note that new linked defect is also not reproduced each time so is the case in this bug, you hit this situation some times not all the times.

** Basically you start seeing this behavior when pages render slow or very slow due to any reason. It does not matter which page/table/content it can happen anywhere -

Hi Abhilasha,

We have verified this issue on QAE/QAD/QAF env and found this issue reproducible only 1time out of 20 times however its working fine on FF.
Please refer to attached screenshot.

Closing this issue right now, not seeing the processing error now with the new fixes.
If we discover this again in different places will track it seperate.

item.title: [NG-12872] Highlighting math puts a highlight span within the script tag for mathML
item.description:
1. Highlight any math in uberdoc. Save the highlight.
2. Inspect the highlight using firebug (or similar)
3. Open the mathML script tag and observe a higlight span inside it and surrounding the mathML stored there.

Expected: text inside script tags should not get highlight spans applied to them.

Problem: In this case, it could mess up mathJax display in unforeseen ways and causes problems in 2.5 for showing highlighted math in the notepad.

There is an issue that may be related to this behavior:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Go to Uberdoc chapter 2 section 2.2a
2. Start your selection at "Why It's easier to solve an equation that involves only integers." and extend it past the set of equations and end it at "Check the solution by substituting"
3. Open the Notepad and check your annotation displays math correctly.
4. Change the color of the highlight.
5. Check the Notepad app and see how the math disappeared.

Tech: this is probably a change to the inline annotation insert code to just ignore script tags in general.
item.summary: Highlighting math puts a highlight span within the script tag for mathML

comments.comment:
Known Impact to the end user:

Steps:
a) Create a highlight with Math content in it and confirm all ok in the notepad.
b) Extend the highlight or change the color for few more works.
c) Check the notepad and notice that the math formula dropped from the highlight.
Linking another bug - investigating if related to this one or the actual story.
Script tags were introduced to the application via MathJax. This is just a new condition to check for those tags before wrapping in annotations(such as highlights).
this is still an issue now since the code to fix this was reverted as per Alexis. Re-opening this issue able to reproduce.
Reviewed by Karen
This particular issue is good - closing after confirming on IE9 and other browsers. Additional testing as part of other stories and overall regression.

item.title: [NG-10791] Manually Added reading activity TOC with HTML tags not updating on Refresh
item.description:
Course360 MT
Nutrition
Sizer
Print Edition ISBN: 9781133628187

Open the "Unit 4".
Go to "Chapter 7" under "Required Readings".
Goto "7-10e Vitamin B".
Heading in the TOC does not match with the heading on reading activity
The subscripts are not correctly formatted

Refresh did not fix this
The TOC is correct in new manually added reading activity, though refreshing the new manually added reading activity reverts the TOC and the issue still exists

Testing note:

  • Regression test NG-6397 to make sure characters such as '&' continue to display correctly.
  • Regression test the MTQA tickets attached to NG-5852: MTQA-1205, MTQA-2377
  • Test empty AHEAD title

Dev notes
See comments for "NOT DONE" portions of this story.
Need to blacklist tags that can have adverse impact on presentation or functionality: img, script, iframe, etc. Need to confirm this list.

  1. Book: add get/set markupTitle. DONE
  2. Chapter: add get/set markupTitle. DONE
  3. Section: add get/set markupTitle. DONE
  4. Section: add get/set markupInnerSectionTitle *NOT DONE**
  1. Dom4jBookParser: read markupTitle from elements and populate book, chapter, section. DONE
  2. Handle markupContainsSectionTitle as well **NOT DONE** (rename the element to containsMarkupTitle)
  1. DefaultCendocTransformerTest - add test to verify markupTitle element is at all Book, Chapter, Section levels. DONE
  1. VelocityChapterOutlineService: DONE
    remove Velocity.
    take refToc and grab section[0]
    turn the contents section into a dom element
    spin thru the dom and remove li elements who do not have a link with a section id we want to keep
    (hint/warning: xpath might be involved)
item.summary: Manually Added reading activity TOC with HTML tags not updating on Refresh

comments.comment:
It appears that MTQA-10771 is a related issue. When the WC is refreshed for this title, the A-head and B-head to which this content is related to does not appear on the TOC. but the TOC appears correctly when adding a new reading activity. OR is this related to NG-10281?
If MTQA-10771 is NOT related to the same bug then please let Carrie know ASAP as this other issue must be resolved as well for 2.1
Determined that MTQA-10771 is not related to this bug but instead is related to NG-10281 and NG-10926

Hi Lori - we need a transform change for this ticket. SInce we now want to see the embedded html in a chapter or section title (things like subscripts) we need to be able to access that type of content in the platform.

<cl:sect2 identifier="AHKVEX920181704">
<cl:complex-meta>
<cl:title identifier="XDFCDZ762362657">Vitamin B<cl:subscript>12</cl:subscript> Roles</cl:title>
</cl:complex-meta>

we now get a variable named 'title' that contains 'Vitamin B12 Roles'

So, can you create a new xsl variable for us, called 'markupTitle', that would contain 'Vitamin B<sub>12</sub> Roles' for the fragment above?

We need this for Chapters, AHeads, BHeads, Closers, and the empty AHead/Closer 'containsSection..." areas. One area is around line 731 in chapter.xsl.

This probably also pertains to cl:articles and non-book readings as well

Thanks

The platform uses the title attribute in order to add the title to a C360 book. We cannot embed tags in an attribute. This is a known platform issue. Would you like a <sectionTitle> output?

<section class="PAGE" id="AHKVEX920181704" type="BHEAD" label="7-10e" title="Vitamin B12 Roles">
<content>
<div class="container page ">
<div id="header">
<div id="breadcrumb">
<a id="chapterTitle" href="javascript://" data-link-type="outline">Chapter Contents</a>
</div>
<h2 id="XDFCDZ762362657">
<span class="sectionLabel">7-10e</span>
<span class="headingText">Vitamin B<sub>12</sub> Roles</span>
</h2>
</div>

So create this instead:

<section class="PAGE" id="AHKVEX920181704" type="BHEAD" label="7-10e" title="Vitamin B12 Roles">
<sectionTitle>Vitamin B<sub>12</sub> Roles</sectionTitle>
<content>
<div class="container page ">
<div id="header">
<div id="breadcrumb">
<a id="chapterTitle" href="javascript://" data-link-type="outline">Chapter Contents</a>
</div>
<h2 id="XDFCDZ762362657">
<span class="sectionLabel">7-10e</span>
<span class="headingText">Vitamin B<sub>12</sub> Roles</span>
</h2>
</div>
The changes have been checked into develop and pushed to QAE.
Leave the title attribute alone and add an attribute called markupTitle.

I've changed to use the following new attributes, markupTitle, markupPartTitle, markupContainsSectionTitle. Checked into develop and moved to QAE. The title attribute does not contain escape characters any longer.

Note to QA testing this bug:
a) Ensure both type of activities display this change - manual individually added and auto created.
b) New book
c) Refresh existing book (find an example of book that has this problem and ensure Refresh will fix)
d) Check the related mtqa tickets for anything that needs to be verified as part of this bug - follow up with Carrie.
e) This is a transform change so need to ENSURE transform checklist is executed from regression prospective.
g) See if there are any additional examples in other titles that can be tested too.
We are blocking this pending on NG-11264. We need the updated XSL.
Waiting on NG-11264
MTQA-10055 has a complete list of all our ISBNs with <cl:style> in TOC

Since the scope of this bug increased to support more than the subscript in the existing manually added reading activity TOC, I am moving this out of 2.1.
It is my understanding that the additional work on the MT platform side is minimal. Therefore, I suggest that the work be completed in a separate branch and not checked into Develop.

Jared S, please work with Sajid and Abdul to identify what query would need to be run on the Cendoc to find which titles would be affected.
Emily and I will review this after 2.1 release to determine next steps.

By Sajid & Abdul:
We are going to pause development on this while addressing more urgent issues.
We have git branch: NG-10791-parser in (ng-nbreader)
It includes the changes made by Lori for NG-11264, these are xsl files changes.
Additionally, we made the following plan to address this story:

1. Book: add get/set markupTitle. DONE
2. Chapter: add get/set markupTitle. DONE
3. Section: add get/set markupTitle. DONE

item.title: [NG-12345] Appification: Add mechanism to add/modify a sharedKey(Secret) in MT
item.description:
As Cengage, I need a mechanism to set up and maintain the shared secret key for each app.

Acceptance Criteria

1. Add ability to add, edit or remove shared secret key in the UI.

  • Available to the SuperAdmin role ONLY.
  • Add mechanism to add/modify a sharedKey in MT for a MT-App Combination in the Admin UI

UI Changes (see attached screenshot):
On Both Deploy New App and Edit App pages:

  • Add Shared Secret Input Box and Confirmation Input box
  • Entries into both fields should be obfuscated via dots

Error handling:

  • Display error if entry in Entry field and Confirmation field do not match:
    The Shared Secrets you entered do not match. Please try again.
  • Display error if characters which aren't allowed are entered: Invalid character input, please use only [a-zA-Z0-9!@#$%^&.)(\-_=+*:]
  • are there other errors ???

Note:
Users will know if a shared secret exists by the presence of dots in the field. If they wish to remove the shared secret, they remove it from both the input and confirm fields and save.

2. SharedKey should be encrypted and stored in the APP table
Allow for the SharedKey to be added/modified during APP,(re)Deploy.
Allow a max of 64 chars
RegEX pattern of chars [a-zA-Z0-9!@#$%^&.)(\-_=+*:]

For more information, see: https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/MindTap+and+MindApps+Security

Note: For apps maintained by MT, there will be separate stories for them to implement use of the shared secret. Because the shared secret is backward compatible, the apps can do this on their own timelines.
item.summary: Appification: Add mechanism to add/modify a sharedKey(Secret) in MT

comments.comment: Are there wireframes for this?
Attachment having Email Conversation on UI with Amy and Claude.
Did the code changes and committed under develop branch.

Spaces are not allowed.
If an admin copies and pastes in a string with long characters past 64 then it will truncate the letters/numbers to 64. It will only paste in 64 characters.
If there is a space before the 64 characters, then the shared secret will give an error. If there is a space after the 64 characters, then the characters will still be pasted w/o the space and will be able to be set.
Logged in as production user - and they do not have access to the app library page.
Each time an secret is updated, there is a new value in the app table.

item.title: [NG-12661] Appification: Secure Server to Server communication - Sign MindTap request using Shared Secret
item.description:
Enhance MT-App Server to Server communication so that the communication between MT and APPs is secure

Secure the following fields in our server to server communication using the shared key per App so that the server to server communication used for MT-App Communication is secure

AC
Backward Compatibility: Changes are additive so they do not require changes if the App decides to ignore security attributes (timestamp, signature)

AC
Ensure All Server to Server communication including Lifecycle API ,Progress API should be secure

AC
Each app-MT combination will have its own signature value as the underlying secret varies.

AC
The following attributes that MUST be secured using the shared key
1. MessageID
2. SnapshotID
3. eventType
4. timestamp

AC.
MT-Sign, MT-Timestamp must be included in the HTTP header-used for signing the 4 attributes

AC
AppContext with Timestamp that is older than TBD(Same as Cengage Token) hours should be considered as not valid

For more information, see: https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/MindTap+and+MindApps+Security
item.summary: Appification: Secure Server to Server communication - Sign MindTap request using Shared Secret

comments.comment:
Adding security headers for Lifecycle and Progress notifications/API.

Note to QA:
Perform general regression around Lifecycle and Progress notifications/API calls.

Failure Notification Testing can be performed via RestClient by taking id from notification message from mongo. Following is the sample that can be used from RestClient:
POST: http://localhost/nb/service/appMessage/failureNotification
{"id": "65619245-6595-41b8-b066-13b5e4707baf", "error":{"retry": "true", "msg": ""}}

item.title: [NG-12457] Appification: Secure AppContext so that the data communicated between MT and APPs is secure
item.description:
Enhance APP Context so that the communication between MT and APPs is secure

Secure the following attributes in the AppContext using the shared key per App so that the App Context used for MT-App Communication is secure

AC
Backward Compatibility: Changes are additive to the current context, they do not require changes if the App decides to ignore security attributes (timestamp, signature)

AC
Each app-MT combination will have its own signature value as the underlying secret varies.

AC
The following list of AppContext attributes that MUST be secure
1. role
2. nextBookId
3. imsSourcedId (userId)
4. timestamp

AC.
New Attribute Timestamp must be included in the AppContext in the unix format

AC
AppContext with Timestamp that is older than TBD(Same as Cengage Token) hours should be considered as not valid

AC
Context must be secure should include both inline and Distinct Assignments

For more information, see: https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/MindTap+and+MindApps+Security
item.summary: Appification: Secure AppContext so that the data communicated between MT and APPs is secure

item.title: [NG-12515] Update AA App to use Shared Secret
item.description:
As Cengage, I need the communication between MT and AA to be secure for the Server to Server communication ( Progress API and LifeCycle Events)

Acceptance Criteria

  • Update AA app to be able to utilize shared secret for notifications built in (NG-12457)
  • There should be a way to set a Shared Secret in AA via an entry that is configurable and stored in database.
  • Once a shared secret is set, any request coming from MindTap should be signed
  • If the signature does not match, or if not signed, an error should be returned and no action taken
  • All LifecyCycle and Progress events should be secured
  • Process to make changes to Shared Secret need to be documented and reviewed

item.title: [NG-7475] Progress: Delete Student Take Confirmation
item.description:
As an instructor, Course Care or SuperAdmin I need to be able to confirm the Deletion of a Student Take so that I know I have selected the appropriate take.

Acceptance Criteria

When an instructor selects the Delete link related to a selected take from either the Activities or Student tab of the Progress app, display the Delete Take dialog.

The dialog displays the following:

  • Text: Are you sure you want to delete this attempt? This cannot be undone.
  • Student Name
  • Activity Name
  • Submission Date, Score% (earned points/possible points)
  • 'Yes, delete the attempt' button
    • If the assignment is past it's due date, display text:
    • Due Date has passed. This attempt may be deleted, however the student will not be able to attempt the activity again.
    • Clicking this button results in the attempt being deleted in MindTap:
      • The number of remaining takes for the activity increases by 1
      • The attempt no longer appears in Progress:
      • The score is not displayed in Progress or in the LPN
      • Score is not used in any calculations, ie) class average
      • Recalculate activity score and class average
      • Initiates send of notification to relevant homework app (NG-12680)
      • Initiates adding of comment (NG-12642)

***If the instructor has deleted the only take a student has submitted - the instructor should have the ability to edit options. The is_Student_Started flag should be set back to zero and allow the instructor to make changes to the assignment. Also it seems something might need to clear cache for the instructor to see the changes right away.

        • After clicking the 'Yes, Delete the attempt' button,
          • If the homework app subscribes to the delete take notification and the notification was sent successfully OR the homework app does not subscribe to the delete take notification: the dialog closes, the user is returned to where they came from (Activities or Student tab). The take no longer appears in the list and the Activity window should be hidden.
          • If the homework app subscribes to the delete take notification and MT does not receive a success for the notification, display the following error text (beneath the 'This can not be undone' text, in orange): Attempt could not be deleted. Please try again later.
  • 'Cancel' button
    • Clicking the this button closes the dialog and returns the user to the page they came from with no changes.
  • If the institution uses grade synch through MindLinks and the attempt deletion results in the Recorded Score changing, the recorded score should be synched (the new functionality here is that we now send empty grades when the last attempt is deleted i.e. earnedScore is empty string in that case).

***Behavior of Attempt Bubble from LPN:
****Students must open the Attempt Modal to gain access to Review Mode in all cases (this is a change from today where if there is only 1 take, they are sent directly to Review Mode when clicking their score).

****If there are no submissions and no comments:
no score and no comment bubble displays (as today). Clicking on the Title opens the first take.
****If there are comment(s), but no scores (could happen if all take(s) have been deleted):
display comment bubble, clicking comment bubble opens attempt modal with appropriate comments and deleted takes (if any).
If there are takes remaining, the title is link to a new take. Else, it is not a link.
****If there are score(s), but no comments:
clicking on the score opens the attempt bubble with the list of take(s) and score(s).
If there are takes remaining, the title is link to a new take. Else, it is not a link.
****If there are score(s) and comment(s):
display score and comment bubble. Both link to the attempt modal listing the attempts and scores for existing and deleted takes (if any), as well as all comments.
If there are takes remaining, the title is link to a new take. Else, it is not a link.
item.summary: Progress: Delete Student Take Confirmation

comments.comment:
Thoughts:
1. Delete the AO and AOD records if only one take.
2. Delete AOD and apply Score strategy to update AO if multiple takes
3. Update the attempts in AO based on remaining AOD records
4. Modify the trigger which update the effective score to fire on DELETE in AO for #1

Made changes so studentStarted flag is set to 1 when student started the take for any home-work app (used to be only set for AA).
And when instructor deletes student take, studentStarted flag is set 0 if its the last take for that activity.

Note that the optionEditable is thus now really functional and should be tested, see doc:
https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/Assignable+Activity+MindApp.

ZTest has been updated to create 2 distinct activities, one with optionEditable, one with it false.

item.title: [NG-7474] Progress: Ability to Reset/Delete a Student Take UI/Workflow changes
item.description:
As an Instructor, SuperAdmin or Course Care user, I need to be able to select a student take, view the take and see the option to delete the take so that I can take action on the appropriate take.

Acceptance Criteria

From Activities Detail page of Progress App (navigate here either from Activities tab > Select Individual Activity > Select Individual Student OR from Student > Select Individual Student > Select Individual Activity)

  • Instructor selects student
    • Attempt Modal displays:
    • One row per submitted/completed attempt, in ascending order by Attempt #
    • Display Attempt 1, Submission Date, Recorded Score, View Button and Delete Link.
      • View Button launches attempt in Review Mode.
      • Delete Link opens the Delete Take Confirm Dialog (NG-7475)
    • When the dialog opens, if a take had previously been discarded, the discarded take will appear in grey with a strike through (see attached wireframe*). The discarded attempt retains it's original attempt #, meaning for example if 3 attempts are allowed and attempt 2 is discarded, attempt 2 appears with the strike through. The additional take which is now available would be take 4, if the student takes it.
      Note that the discarded take strike through appears in the attempt model for both in the Progress App and from the LPN.
  • though the wireframe with strikeout with attempts in descending order, we display them in ascending order by attempt #.
  • Instructors must only have ability to Delete completed Takes
item.summary: Progress: Ability to Reset/Delete a Student Take UI/Workflow changes

item.title: [NG-7178] IE8: Annotations: Proper display of highlighted text on the page is modified by presence of Inline Activities, embedded images, GTs, sidebars if created below them/Errors, not displayed, broken navigation if created close to the bottom of the page
item.description:
Leaving the initial description as-is. For current behavior please see Iryna's comments from 11/16/12.

In all Big Five books on the pages with Inline Activities (AA, Media, Text, Blog, GD).

Taking Mankiw Principles of Microeconomics (ISBN 9780538453042) as an example.

Steps to reproduce:

  • Log in as Instructor or a Student into a snapshot, open RA e.g., Chapter 1.

Case 1: Pages WITHOUT Inline Activities:
1. Navigate to Chapter Introduction page or any other page WITHOUT added Inline Activity(ies).
2. Select text and create Annotations (HL and/or QN).
3. Open Notepad and observe what is highlighted on the page and in Notepad.

Actual result: decoration is offset by 1 character to the right on both sides - please see screen shot 1 (IE8_1_HL on the page without Inline_after creation).

4. Navigate 2+ pages away and back.

Actual result: decoration is offset by 1 character to the left on both sides - please see screen shot 2 (IE8_2_HL on the page without Inline_after navigation).

Case 2: Pages WITH Inline Activities/Creating Annotations BELOW them:
1. Navigate to section 1-1 which has Inline AA added (or any other page WITH any added Inline Activity(ies)).
2. Select text and create Annotations (HL and/or QN).
Note: in this case Annotations will be created below Inline AA. If Annotations are created to text ABOVE - Annotations are properly displayed on the page and in Notepad).
3. Open Notepad and compare text highlighted on the page and in Notepad.

Actual result:

  • decoration is offset by many characters to the right on both sides - please see screen shot 3 (IE8_3_HL on the page with Inline_after creation);
  • in Notepad: highlights do not match what was selected and what is currently displayed on the page.

4. Navigate 2+ pages away and back.

Actual result: incorrect text is highlighted - please see screen shot 4 (IE8_4_HL on the page with Inline_after navigation).
item.summary: IE8: Annotations: Proper display of highlighted text on the page is modified by presence of Inline Activities, embedded images, GTs, sidebars if created below them/Errors, not displayed, broken navigation if created close to the bottom of the page

comments.comment: Not a 2.0 candidate.
Verified this issue on QAE Environment and found it still reproducible for the mentioned Steps.
Verified this issue on QAD Env. and found it still reproducible.

Re-tested in production (2.3) on 11/14/2012 and on staging (2.4): the issue is reproducible and the behavior got worse:
1. Launch e.g., Norton 9781133353706, Ch 2-1d where there are GTs in the 1st paragraph.
2. Select text above 1st GT and create HL -> confirm the highlights are displayed on the page (sometimes offset by a couple of characters).
3. Select some text in the 2nd paragraph and create HL.

Actual result: highlights are displayed much lower then the selected text.

4. Select text in the last line in the last paragraph and create HL.

Actual result: HL are not getting created, error (see below).

4. Refresh the page and from TOC click on 2-1d.

Actual result: broken navigation. Though the page is displayed (not top and without Annotations), the page has only one next navigation button and Skimmer is at the extreme left position indicating that it is a Chapter Contents page.

5. Log out and log in again and open any other RA.
6. From Notepad click on the last created HL.

Actual result: spinner in progress - Reader is not displayed (same error as below). *NOTE: this effects ANY browser.*



Webpage error details

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/4.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; .NET4.0C; InfoPath.3; .NET4.0E)

item.title: [NG-9354] Create a new bookmark
item.description:
As a student or instructor, I want to be able to create a bookmark on a reading, so I can refer back to a section of my reading when I'm studying or preparing for a class.

This story will cover work needed for clicking a page to be bookmarked and storing it in the database, and any additional actions done in Reader.

Acceptance Criteria

  • Bookmark icon should be visible on each page as "unselected" before any action has been completed
  • Icon should only appear in Reading Activity, not in the Full Book app
  • Must be able to click bookmark icon and store it in the database
  • Must be able to have the bookmark render as "selected" or remain "selected" when:
    • click on the icon
    • navigate away and come back to the page in the same session
    • when log out of MT and come back
    • when switch activities during the same session
    • leave session and returns during a different session
    • user views from a different browser or device
  • Chapter name, section, number should be stored for the bookmark (confirm with mock ups/UX)
  • This functionality needs to be available to the student or instructor role but does not need to be restricted from other MindTap roles.
  • The mark should be persistent until removed (NG-10054)
item.summary: Create a new bookmark

- Verified for various roles like Student/Admin/Instructor/Production.
- Bookmark saved within/ and in new session as Checked for the Mongo DB Records - db.bookmarks.user_bookmarks.find({"snapshotId" : 13925})

item.title: [NG-9770] Progress: overall score - saving is not graying out when saving the score
item.description:
Go to the progress app to change the overall score for a student.
Click on Edit score and then save after entering a value in the textbox.
The text becomes Saving, but the admin can keep on clicking on it so it save mulitple records of the same data.
This saving should be grayed out so the admin does not create mulitple records.
item.summary: Progress: overall score - saving is not graying out when saving the score

comments.comment: Verified this issue on QAE Environment and found it still reproducible for the mentioned Steps.

This is only happening if a user clicks too fast multiple times. Such issue may also occur for our existing buttons in most of the places in MindTap.

This problem is already handled using a check if the button label is 'Saving...' then don't proceed further but if the 2nd click happens so fast then it fails. This problem occurs only when you double click(Clicking too fast multiple times) on the button which eventually create race condition i.e. second call comes before first changes the button label to 'Saving....'. We tried few solutions to fix this issue:
1. Set a boolean flag in controller and setting it to true which prevent second call.
2. Disabling the button on click then re-enable it at the end.

But that didn't help, need help from JS/UX expert on this for better solution.
