item.title: [NG-11715] Support rendering MathML in TOC in manually added RAs in Reader and Full Book
item.description:
as a user, I need to see math/chem notation in the Table of Contents in a reading activity so I have access to all of the content in its proper format in reader

TOC in this context is when you navigate from whole book TOC to a chapter, and the chapter has its own TOC. This is where we want to make MathML works.
Example in the uberdoc, if you go to chapter 12, you will see TOC for chapter 12. We need this TOC to work with MathML.

Acceptance criteria
MathML should successfully render under the following circumstances:

MT App MT Feature Section Level Activity Type Method of Adding Activity Method of Update
Reader ToC Chapter level Book Reading Activity Automatic None (from scratch)
Reader ToC A-head Book Reading Activity Automatic None (from scratch)
Reader ToC B-head Book Reading Activity Automatic None (from scratch)
Reader ToC Chapter level Book Reading Activity Manually Added None (from scratch)
Reader ToC A-head Book Reading Activity Manually Added None (from scratch)
Reader ToC B-head Book Reading Activity Manually Added None (from scratch)
Reader ToC Chapter level Book Reading Activity Automatic After Refresh
Reader ToC A-head Book Reading Activity Automatic After Refresh
Reader ToC Chapter level Book Reading Activity Manually Added After Refresh
Reader ToC A-head Book Reading Activity Manually Added After Refresh
Reader ToC B-head Book Reading Activity Manually Added After Refresh
Reader ToC Create CourseMode at A-head Book Reading Activity Automatic None(from scratch)
Reader ToC Create CourseMode at A-head Book Reading Activity Automatic(from scratch) After Refresh

Implementation notes:

  • Per Ron on 8/23, may need server-side change to address
  • The implementation to support this for automatically-added activities is covered by NG-11410. The scenario table above includes the automatically-added scenarios for verification & regression testing only.

Out of scope for this story

  • Not required to format/style MathML notation as rest of ToC link (e.g. underlined, blue)

Notes

Automatic: when you create a MT
Manual: in Learning Path, add activity and choose a reading activity, then select a chapter or a section.
item.summary: Support rendering MathML in TOC in manually added RAs in Reader and Full Book

item.title: [NG-11929] Save XSLT version during content ingestion
item.description:
As the MindTap system, I want to save the version of the transform (XSLT) during content ingestion, so that I later have it for traceability and recoverability.

Acceptance Criteria:

  • When a new MindTap Master is built, there is a record of which "version" of the XSLT was used
  • "Version" for the purposes of this story - just a github commit tag (e.g. f8d38665e2ab6c3e322da6d5d259427e32194a89)
  • On the Creation of a new Master, there is a record saved of the "version" of the XSLT for that creation
  • On Refresh of an existing Master (Unpublished) there is a record saved of the "version" of the XSLT for that refresh
  • Add a field to the Content_Key & to the Ref TOCs, to represent this (content_keys.fingerprint.xslVersion, refToc.fingerprint.xslVersion, activityToc.fingerprint.xslVersion)
  • Working Copy – when WC is merged, delete the corresponding data for the WC and move the version to that of the Master – potentially not necessary; we have this data in the content_keys collection and we migrate content key from working copy to master. we should create separate story for tracking refresh history.

Questions:

  • Do we need to add this github tag (or whatever) to the header of the XSLT itself? – covered by NG-11956
  • Then save to the db for every snapshotId??
  • For Refresh, do we need to save the previous version of the XSLT as well? Meaning, do we need to save every version that was used in the history of a MindTap, for each Refresh?
    • Current and Previous at least – consider saving all if it's easy enough (to save create date, user, content set ID, etc.)
item.summary: Save XSLT version during content ingestion

item.title: [NG-11544] New Added Assignable Activities do not get the default Due Date
item.description:
The course end date is the default Due Date for Assignable Activities. However, the default date is not populated (the first time) an admin adds an assignable activity (inline or distinct).

Expected : Default due date should be populated for an Assignable Activity when no Due Date has been specified.

Actual: The default due date gets populated on the LPN after the admin refreshes the LPN (or screen)

Steps to reproduce:
1. Login to QAE: http://qae-ng.cengage.com/static/nb/login.html
2. Navigate to the course from the Organizations Page using the path:
Organizations -> AQUINAS JUNIOR COLLEGE -> ARS_AUTO_SUBMIT -> Ehrlich - Official SSO ISBN
3. Navigate to Unit: Chapter 1.
4. Add an assignable activity as a Superadmin.
5. Check the Activity on the LPN. There should not be a Due Date populated undeer the Activity Name.
6. Refresh the browser session and the Course End Date should be populated as the Due Date on the LPN.

This is an issue only for Superadmin and Vendor role users only today.
Instructors cannot add distinct or inline in AA today. Instructors will be able to add distinct or inline activities with new homework apps, so this will be a problem for them then. Course Care, Production do not have the ability to add activities to Snapshots/Courses.
item.summary: New Added Assignable Activities do not get the default Due Date

comments.comment: As we discussed, the issue is only fixed for LPN and not for Inline Assignment Activity for Superadmin.

Verified over QAE environment

Now adding any Distinct AA w/o Due Date then Course end Date is automatically picked and shown in LPN w/o User refresh

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: New activity meta data was not being retrieved after activity was created.

item.title: [NG-12285] AA: Enhance MT to re-try and log error message when -1 scores/error is received from Homework Apps
item.description:
Currently when the student submits for grade for an assignment and there is a time out issue with cnow, we set a -1 for the students score.

We need a better way to handle and acknowledge the communication time out so we (MT) can fix the scores of these students.

AC
-Log appropriate error received in Log so that it can be monitored

AC
-Add re-try logic on the Server Side if MT receives error from Assignment Apps

AC
--MT should re-try 3 times with a 5 second wait between re-trys before setting -1 score.

exceptions in the logs:
[2012-10-09 22:01:08,582] ERROR service.DefaultAssignmentService – Problem getting the final Score from Covalent for attemptId: 7ea0e188-c151-42b3-b298-4e16f211aecc
java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
item.summary: AA: Enhance MT to re-try and log error message when -1 scores/error is received from Homework Apps

comments.comment:
I would put this another way.

If we don't get a response from covalent when getting the final score - we should try again as opposed to just setting the score to -1 - or do something else to indicate that there was a problem.

We can monitor splunk for the error when this occurs - but more concerned about preventing it from happening (or better safeguarding against it).

If we do plan to continue to store the -1 when theres a problem getting the score from covalent - we should consider doing something better in the UI when this occurs as well.

Dev Note:
Its happening from DefaultActivityOutcomeDetailService.getFinalScoreFromApp().
If there is an error thrown from covalent or socket-timeout we mark final score as -1.

Adding another error from the logs:

[2012-10-28 21:50:41,012] ERROR service.DefaultAssignmentService -- Problem marking assignement complete for attemptId:6621797f-9d4c-4ba1-8042-7d5c2a9e1439 in covalent side.
org.apache.http.NoHttpResponseException: The target server failed to respond
at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultResponseParser.parseHead(DefaultResponseParser.java:101)
at org.apache.http.impl.io.AbstractMessageParser.parse(AbstractMessageParser.java:252)
at org.apache.http.impl.AbstractHttpClientConnection.receiveResponseHeader(AbstractHttpClientConnection.java:282)
at org.apache.http.impl.conn.DefaultClientConnection.receiveResponseHeader(DefaultClientConnection.java:247)
at org.apache.http.impl.conn.AbstractClientConnAdapter.receiveResponseHeader(AbstractClientConnAdapter.java:216)
at org.apache.http.protocol.HttpRequestExecutor.doReceiveResponse(HttpRequestExecutor.java:298)
at org.apache.http.protocol.HttpRequestExecutor.execute(HttpRequestExecutor.java:125)
at org.apache.http.impl.client.DefaultRequestDirector.tryExecute(DefaultRequestDirector.java:647)

reviewed by Claude

For testing we used debugger to mangle the URL.

Recieved a demo from Claude and saw the exceptions in the logs being generated. Saw that -MT should re-try 3 times with a 5 second wait between re-trys before setting -1 score. There is the other story with the -1 ui fix we can test out the ui with. If the retry passes on the second attempt, then it stops retring this as well.

item.title: [NG-12839] MindApp student will see a warning message and disabled submit buttons if/until we have an attemptId.
item.description:
The purpose of this ticket on the MindTap side is to see if there is any issue with the steal and CLUI SSO init which would cause unreliable behavior.

See Dave's comment dated on nov 19.

From ILRN Original Issue:

=== USER STORY ===
As a student using CengageNOW as a provisioned MT HW App, if the MindApp cannot get an attemptId from MindTap when the take interface appears, I will see a warning message and disabled submit buttons. The warning message will disappear and the submit buttons will enable when the MindApp gets an attemptId from MindTap.

=== ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA ===
• If the MindApp cannot get an attemptId from MindTap when the take interface appears...
  - "Warning: You can't submit until we connect with MindTap. Moving to another question will retry the connection." should appear (without quotation marks) left justified between the assignment title and the take interface.
  - "Warning:" in the message above should appear in red text. The rest of the message should use black text.
  - The "Submit Assignment for Grading" buttons should be disabled.
  - The rollover text for the "Submit Assignment for Grading" buttons should be set to the warning message.
• If the MindApp succeeds in getting an attemptId from MindTap while loading another question...
  - The warning text should disappear.
  - The "Submit Assignment for Grading" buttons should become enabled.
  - The rollover text for the "Submit Assignment for Grading" buttons should return to the text of the button label.
item.summary: MindApp student will see a warning message and disabled submit buttons if/until we have an attemptId.

comments.comment:
Dave's Comments from ILRN-55201

Dave Bernstein added a comment - 19/Nov/12 4:25 PM
looks like we are not getting a response from steal in some cases. We are intermittently seeing steal not call our callbacks passed, and do not see any pattern.
Some code illustrating the issue:
getUserSSOToken: function(callback) {
            console.log("Into getUserSSOToken");
            steal('clui/app', 'clui/sso').then(function(ev) {
                console.log("function(ev)!");
                Clui.SSO.ready(function(sso){
                    console.log("function(sso)!");
                    callback(sso.getSSOToken());
                });
            });
            console.log("Done!");
        }
When things work, we see in the console:
Into getUserSSOToken
Done!
function(ev)!
function(sso)!
when things fail, we see in the console:
Into getUserSSOToken
Done!
I think we'll need to investigate with help from mindtap team. Requesting that we create an NG slip.

We tried different approaches including adding a app using the diffrent version of jQuery, but not able to replicate the problem. Need more information from App side, if they are seeing error something like any of js not able to load.

Based on investigation "then" method will only called if all the files successfully downloaded by steal.
Can someone please provide details on what browser produced this scenario? And can someone please user Ids, course keys for the screenshots that are in this ticket.
Dave's is getting a new run on CNow QA to check this is still an existing issue.

Investigation found that CNow should clean up some code on their side. The issue has been sent back to Cnow side. The thought is this is not a MT issue, so closing this on our side. If the issue returns, we can re-open it on the MT side.

item.title: [NG-12735] Enhance the MindTap UI when -1 scores/App does not return score
item.description:
Currently when the student submits for grade for an assignment and there is a time out issue with cnow, we set a -1 for the students score.

We need a better message that needs to be displayed when an error is returned from the h/w app

AC
In the LPN for either Distinct or Inline activities (for Students):

  • If 1 or more attempt scores making up the Recorded Score have a value of -1, Rather than display the Recorded Score in LPN, Attempt Bubble for Inline and Distinct assignments, display a red exclamation point with a hover containing the text: Score is pending.
  • If the red exclamation point displays rather than the score, it links to the Attempt Modal.
  • The Attempt Modal will display a red exclaimation point as the score for any attempt which has a -1 score.
  • From the Attempt Model, the the user should not be able to open an assignment with a -1 score as they will see an error. The View button should be disabled.

Immediately after assignment submission:

  • Display a spinner while retry process is happening so student is aware that MT is processing their submission.
  • Once retry completes, display assignment in Review Mode (as occurs today for assignments which do not need the retry).

In the Progress App:

  • On the Activities Details page, if 1 or more attempt scores making up the Recorded Score have a value of -1, instead of the Recorded Score, display a red exclamation point with a hover containing the text: Score is pending.
  • On the Attempt Bubble, display a Red Exclaimation mark where the attempt score is -1.
  • From the Attempt Model, the the user should not be able to open an assignment with a -1 score as they will see an error. The View button should be disabled.

Example of how a -1 score could exist:
exceptions in the logs:
[2012-10-09 22:01:08,582] ERROR service.DefaultAssignmentService – Problem getting the final Score from Covalent for attemptId: 7ea0e188-c151-42b3-b298-4e16f211aecc
java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)

There are also other situations where Progress populates a -1, for example if possible points has been set to 0. It would be good to be aware any time a -1 is populated and the possible cause.
item.summary: Enhance the MindTap UI when -1 scores/App does not return score

comments.comment: reviewed by Surya/Claude
Seeing an undefined for inline activities when there is one attempt and it has a -1 score. Also not seeing the hoover over message all the time.
Making changes to inline to display the !.

Unable to reproduce locally to display undefined. Instead got -1.
This has been fixed now for inline activities. Moving story to Dev Complete. The code changes are on branch NG-12735-fix-inline-score-update.

Added screenshots for amy to verify easily. Also, it is hard to test out on qaf since we cannot re-try AA. We have forced it to failed.

Immediately after assignment submission:
Display a spinner while retry process is happening so student is aware that MT is processing their submission.
Once retry completes, display assignment in Review Mode (as occurs today for assignments which do not need the retry).

item.title: [NG-12970] Error Handling when Shared Secret invalid
item.description:
As a MindTap user, I need a friendly, explanatory message when I attempt to launch an app where the shared secret between MindTap and the App do not match so that I am aware of why the app will not launch.

Acceptance Criteria

*When a user attempts to launch a homework app for any reason and the security/shared secret check fails, display the following error:
If a 403 is received from the app (as specified in security documentation), display:
Could not establish a secure connection with <App Name>. Please try again later. If the error persists, please contact customer service.

If any other non-successful reply from the app, display:
Trouble communicating with <App Name>. Please try again later. If the error persists, please contact customer service.
item.summary: Error Handling when Shared Secret invalid

comments.comment: Assumption: Apps returns a 403 in case shared secret is not valid
Handle http 403 (caused by shared secret being out of sync) as one error message, with all other exceptions in app communication getting another error message.

Verified no more npe!
To test - made a mismatch in the shared secret.
To test the other message, changed the urls in the assignment.json to be bogus and launched into the assignment.

item.title: [NG-12272] Need to identify a solution to protect production HWApps from actions on test environments (ie. mtdev)
item.description:
We need to identify a solution - either db or systems - to ensure that an environment running a production snapshot (be it a dev sandbox or mtdev) will not have the potential to corrupt data on production HW app instances by sending lifecycle events

Likely approach is to identify a db script to disable those apps :

  • updating root URI in app_action tables to point to a bogus address
  • ensuring view_uris in activity table are updated in order to point to bogus address if necessary
  • disabling autosubmit either via config change or dbupdate.

May also explore doing this at the systems level via network configuration (editing the hosts file - for example)

Need to cover :

  • CNOW
  • Aplia
  • WebAssign
  • LAMS

Proposed Solution :

  • update context.xml to disable auto-submit (setting year to 2020)
    <Environment name="nbcore/cron/autoSubmit" type="java.lang.String" value="0 1 23-2 * * ? 2020" override="false"/>
  • remove all records from APP_PROVISION table for the HW Apps every time we ingest from production
  • update the hosts table to route all server traffic destined for the HW apps URI to local host
item.summary: Need to identify a solution to protect production HWApps from actions on test environments (ie. mtdev)

comments.comment:
Here is a summary of the changes that we need to make before opening up MTDEV:

CONFIG CHANGES
- update context.xml to disable AUTO SUBMIT
<Environment name="nbcore/cron/autoSubmit" type="java.lang.String" value="0 1 23-2 * * ? 2020" override="false"/>

Update the RETRY INTERVALS AND TIMES:
<Environment name="nbcore/RetryScoreRefresher/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/RetryScoreRefresher/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_REMOVED/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_REMOVED/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_ADDED/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_ADDED/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/ACTIVITY_REMOVED/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/ACTIVITY_REMOVED/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/ACTIVITY_ADDED/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/ACTIVITY_ADDED/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_DATA_CHANGED/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_DATA_CHANGED/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/WORKING_COPY_COMMIT/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/WORKING_COPY_COMMIT/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>

SCORE EVENTS:
-- update rows for CNOW
UPDATE APP_SCORE SET ACTION_URI=REPLACE(ACTION_URI,'mindtap.cengagenow.com','localhost')
WHERE ID in (select ITEM_ID from APP_SCORES as A
JOIN APP as B where A.APP_ID=B.ID and B.NAME='CNOW.HW')
AND NAME in('attemptId','attemptScore', 'reactivateAttempt');

-- update rows for Aplia
UPDATE APP_SCORE SET ACTION_URI=REPLACE(ACTION_URI,'courses.aplia.com','localhost')
WHERE ID in (select ITEM_ID from APP_SCORES as A
JOIN APP as B where A.APP_ID=B.ID and B.NAME='Aplia')
AND NAME in('attemptId','attemptScore', 'reactivateAttempt');

LIFECYCLE NOTIFICATIONS:
-- update rows for CNOW
UPDATE APP_LIFE_CYCLE SET ACTION_URI=REPLACE(ACTION_URI,'mindtap.cengagenow.com','localhost')
WHERE ID in (select ITEM_ID from APP_LIFE_CYCLES as A
JOIN APP as B where A.APP_ID=B.ID and B.NAME='CNOW.HW') and NAME='notification';

-- update rows for Aplia
UPDATE APP_LIFE_CYCLE SET ACTION_URI=REPLACE(ACTION_URI,'courses.aplia.com','localhost')
WHERE ID in (select ITEM_ID from APP_LIFE_CYCLES as A
JOIN APP as B where A.APP_ID=B.ID and B.NAME='Aplia') and NAME='notification';

Implementation above will prevent :

- autosubmit from running
- ensure retries are minimized
- ensure lifecycle events do not hit a live server

Left to do :
Update ViewURIs to point to localhost

Potentially :
- Remove WC lifecycle from the HW apps (so they aren't listening for WC events.

-- Query to prevent notifications from being generated.
DELETE from APP_LIFE_CYCLE_EVENTS where APP_LIFE_CYCLE_EVENTS.EVENT_ID IN
(select ID from APP_LIFE_CYCLE_EVENT where
NAME IN('ACTIVITY_ADDED', 'ACTIVITY_REMOVED', 'APP_ADDED', 'APP_REMOVED', 'WORKING_COPY_COMMIT'));

-- UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='CNOW.HW'), 'localhost');
-- UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='lams'), 'localhost');
-- UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='Aplia'), 'localhost');
-- UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='WebAssign'), 'localhost');
-- UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='Cengage.Diet.Analysis.Plus'), 'localhost');
-- UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='Cengage.ConnectYard.Learner'), 'localhost');
-- UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='Merriam-Webster Dictionary Lookup'), 'localhost');

Here is the final set of changes that we need to make when importing Production data to MT Dev:

update context.xml to disable AUTO SUBMIT
<Environment name="nbcore/cron/autoSubmit" type="java.lang.String" value="0 1 23-2 * * ? 2020" override="false"/>

Update the RETRY INTERVALS AND TIMES:
<Environment name="nbcore/RetryScoreRefresher/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/RetryScoreRefresher/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_REMOVED/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_REMOVED/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_ADDED/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_ADDED/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/ACTIVITY_REMOVED/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/ACTIVITY_REMOVED/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/ACTIVITY_ADDED/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/ACTIVITY_ADDED/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_DATA_CHANGED/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/APP_DATA_CHANGED/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/WORKING_COPY_COMMIT/retryIntervalInSeconds" value="5" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>
<Environment name="nbcore/WORKING_COPY_COMMIT/retryRepeatTimes" value="3" type="java.lang.String" override="true"/>

-- Query to update VIEW_URIs for Homework Activities
UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='CNOW.HW'), 'localhost');
UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='lams'), 'localhost');
UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='Aplia'), 'localhost');
UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='WebAssign'), 'localhost');
UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='Cengage.Diet.Analysis.Plus'), 'localhost');
UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='Cengage.ConnectYard.Learner'), 'localhost');
UPDATE ACTIVITY SET VIEW_URI=REPLACE(VIEW_URI, (select SUBSTRING(ROOT_URI,8) from APP where NAME='Merriam-Webster Dictionary Lookup'), 'localhost');

-- Query to prevent notifications from being generated.
DELETE from APP_LIFE_CYCLE_EVENTS where APP_LIFE_CYCLE_EVENTS.EVENT_ID IN (select ID from APP_LIFE_CYCLE_EVENT where
NAME IN('ACTIVITY_ADDED', 'ACTIVITY_REMOVED', 'APP_ADDED', 'APP_REMOVED', 'WORKING_COPY_COMMIT'));

-- Query to prevent sending score events
DELETE from APP_SCORE WHERE ID in (select ITEM_ID from APP_SCORES as A JOIN APP as B where A.APP_ID=B.ID and B.NAME='Aplia') AND NAME in('attemptId','attemptScore', 'reactivateAttempt');
DELETE from APP_SCORE WHERE ID in (select ITEM_ID from APP_SCORES as A JOIN APP as B where A.APP_ID=B.ID and B.NAME='CNOW.HW') AND NAME in('attemptId','attemptScore', 'reactivateAttempt');
DELETE from APP_SCORE WHERE ID in (select ITEM_ID from APP_SCORES as A JOIN APP as B where A.APP_ID=B.ID and B.NAME='lams') AND NAME in('attemptId','attemptScore', 'reactivateAttempt');
DELETE from APP_SCORE WHERE ID in (select ITEM_ID from APP_SCORES as A JOIN APP as B where A.APP_ID=B.ID and B.NAME='WebAssign') AND NAME in('attemptId','attemptScore', 'reactivateAttempt');

item.title: [NG-12394] Highlighting a selection containing text and formulas
item.description:
As a MindTap user, I want to highlight a segment of a reading activity that contains text and formulas and save it to my highlights/note book.

Acceptance Criteria

select plain text that has one or more math objects within it (text does not overlap other html elements)
contextual menu appears with add highlight func
click add highlight with any color
The note gets saved to the database with the text and the mathml. (This is testable by looking at the notepad app and see that the mathml is being shown there)

Technical acceptance criteria

develop a way to save math in the db for annotation
should save text and math markup to annotations in db
should save correct start and end positions to db
Note: keep in mind that this code could be used to highlight images or other elements

Accepted limitations:

  • User experience: formulas may not have a “selected” appearance during the act of selection; background color may only be applied to formulas after the mouse is released
  • The selection cannot start with a formula
  • The selection cannot end with a formula
  • Highlights may not persist or display properly on page refresh or on navigating to another chapter and then navigating back to the highlight. This is a separate story: NG-12395
  • No support for highlighting formulas in a table or an image caption
  • No support for QuickNotes (separate story)
  • Formulas in the highlight may not display properly in the Highlights app. This is a separate story: NG-12392.
item.summary: Highlighting a selection containing text and formulas

comments.comment:
can we add to 'Accepted Limitations'
The selection cannot include part of formula. If it does the CM will not appear, similar to glossary terms
dev review by jesus and karen
Waiting for NG-12911 to be fixed and will re-test after.

The story has been tested and verified on QAE: HL can be successfully created to a selection text+formula+text and are displayed properly in Reader and in Notepad: start and end positions are correct on the page and in Notepad, formulas are displayed in Notepad. Sending to PO for approval.

item.title: [NG-12653] Sizer 9781133628187: Appendix H: Link to Table H-1: Incorrect navigation
item.description:
QAE, production.

One link which is not working properly has been found : link Table H-1. Link inspector does not show any errors.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch Sizer 9781133628187.
2. From LPN open Appendix H, navigate to Appendix Introduction page.
3. Click link Table H-1 (target is on the same page).

Expected result: page is scrolled and target is displayed at the top of the page.

Actual result: page is scrolled (correct) but at the same time Full Book App is opening - incorrect.

(Note: Actual result if from Full Book link Table H-1 is clicked: Appendix H TOC is always displayed - incorrect).

4. In main Reader click next navigation button (section "Calculating Physical Activity Level" is displayed) and confirm links Table H-2 and Table H-3 (targets are on the same page) are working properly, e.i. page is scrolling when click on the links.
5. Click link Table H-1.

Expected result: Full Book opens page "Appendix Introduction" scrolled to the location of the target.

Actual result: Full Book opens Appendix H TOC page.

Optional step to confirm other links which should open FB are working properly: navigate to section "Estimating Physical Activity Level" and click link Table H-3 -> expected and actual correct result: Full Book opens correct page scrolled to the location of Table H-3.

Note: examples where link and target are on the same page - Chapter Introduction - have been found in Chapters 8 (link Figure 8-1), 11 (Figure 11-1), 12 (Table 12-1), 15 (Figure 15-1, Table 15-1) and navigation is correct: as expected the page is scrolled when clicking on the links.
item.summary: Sizer 9781133628187: Appendix H: Link to Table H-1: Incorrect navigation

comments.comment:
Comment from Dick:
The transform always gives us a chapterId, sectionId, and elementId. If the link is for the containing appendix all three will be the same. If the elementId is different then we instead of going to the chapter outline we can go to the actual section.

so, if we make this change we cover both cases

if (sectionId == chapterId {
sectionId = '0';
}

to

if (sectionId === chapterId && elementId === chapterId) {
sectionId = '0';
}
Dev review by Greg, PO reviewed by Carrie
Soumya, please check this one and if we need help from offshore to check this further please send it along.

Tested the examples in Sizer title on FF/Macos:

Same page:
Appendix H
Appendix intro page – Table H-1 – same page, destination at top of page - PASS
Calc physical activity level – table H-2/3 – same page, destination at top of page - PASS

chp introduction : PASS
Chp 8 – figure 8-1
Chp 11 – fig 11-1
Chp 12 – table 12-1
Chp 15 – fig 15-1,table 15-1

Full book

Appendix H

Calc physical activity level – table H-1 – Full book opens App intro page with destination table displayed on top of the page – FAILS on the 1st launch and then works correctly on the consecutive launches
Estimating physical act level – Table – h3 – full book with destination table displayed on top of the page - FAILS on the 1st launch and then works correctly on the consecutive launches

Tables on the appendix H section which are expected to open in Full book and navigate to display the table on the top of the page -does not work on 1st launch and works for consecutive launches.

Moving back to ready as one of the issues still exist.
Looks like there is an existing bug on the above issue. Linked the existing bug NG-11640

Carrie - I found the existing bug for the failing scenario as we spoke and linked to this bug.
The existing bug seems to be part of 2.6. Would like to know if I can then close out this bug as the failure scenario would be anyway addressed in 2.6.

Also, moving this bug back to QA queue from ready. Once decided will move it accrodingly.
Yes,this bug can be closed and we'll address the other open navigation issue in 2.6. thank you

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: did not consider linking to an item on the first section of an appendix

item.title: [NG-12654] (C2C)Gwartney_SSO MINDTAP ECONOMICS FOR MACROECONOMICS_14e_CM(ISBN:9781285381732): Part 3 > Chapter 13 > 13-4 The Business of Banking : Glossary definition pop up is indicating to different gloss term.
item.description:
(C2C)Gwartney_SSO MINDTAP ECONOMICS FOR MACROECONOMICS_14e_CM(ISBN:9781285381732): Part 3 > Chapter 13 > 13-4 The Business of Banking : Glossary definition pop up is indicating to different gloss term.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Enter the URL: http://mindtap.cengage.com/static/nb/login.html
2. Login with valid instructor credential.
3. Go for ISBN “9781285381732” and open the title “Gwartney_SSO MINDTAP ECONOMICS FOR MACROECONOMICS_14e_CM”.
4. Click on "Part 3: Core Macroeconomics".
5. Click on "Chapter 13: Money and the Banking System" and open it.
6. Click on "13-4 The Business of Banking" from TOC.
7. Click on term "Federal Reserve System" on the page.

Actual Result: Glossary definition in the pop up is indicating on the "central bank" term.
Expected Result: Glossary definition pop up for a particular term should indicate to the corresponding term only.

Note: Please refer to the screenshot <<diff_term.jpg>> for more detail.
item.summary: (C2C)Gwartney_SSO MINDTAP ECONOMICS FOR MACROECONOMICS_14e_CM(ISBN:9781285381732): Part 3 > Chapter 13 > 13-4 The Business of Banking : Glossary definition pop up is indicating to different gloss term.

comments.comment: The bug here is with the pointer and not the text of the definition. The callout appears to be pointing back to the "central bank" item when it should really point to "Federal Reserve System"

This is caused by how the first glossary term wraps. It is coincidence that the arrow appears near the second glossary term.

This seems really difficult to fix. The position of the callout is based on the link's bounding box. If the link wraps to two lines, then the bounding box spans the width of the page. If we could recognize when a link wraps and when it doesn't, we could solve this issue. Unfortunately, I don't think there's a straightforward way to do this.
review by Greg. Final solution worked on with Scott

Looks good on QAD -
Checked:
* Activity auto created.
* Manually added.
* Fullbook
* Chrome and FF
* few other pages with glossary term popup, correct descriptions display.

Notified Carrie - will resolve the mtqa ticket or Carrie will review and resolve.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Didn't really handle this properly initially

item.title: [NG-12597] (wait: 12333)Branding: Phase 2- Update Geyser Product Metadata Service to include Branding Discipline
item.description:
as a system, I need to pull in the Branding Discipline value so I can use it to Splash Screen

Acceptance criteria

  • Update the Product Metadata Search Service to read in the "Branding" value and store in core
  • To DO: CM MT's only will require Metadata refresh

INFO on Product Metadata service:

1. This is how this information will be passed in the product metadata JSON, shown by using the uberdoc:
https://preprod.geyser.cl-cms.com/external/rest/product-search.xqy?isbn=9781133314677&format=json&is-primary=1&product-type=Mindtap

"disciplines": [
{ "family": "Branding", "code": "Counseling", "value": "Counseling" },

{ "family": "ORCA", "code": "ACC", "value": "Accounting" }

]

• So, any product can have multiple disciplines
• The discipline you will care about is the one with a family of “Branding”. The actual marketing/branding string should be taken from the “value” field.
• I am showing you an example with multiple disciplines so you’ll know what to expect. I do not expect you to care about the ORCA family/values here.
• The values are nonsensical at this point. When we test on QA, we’ll be more accurate with the actual branding assignments.

2. Additional products to test with:
• Example with an ampersand in the value field
o https://preprod.geyser.cl-cms.com/external/rest/product-search.xqy?isbn=9781418072520&format=json&is-primary=1&product-type=MindTap

• Example with slashes in the value field

item.summary: (wait: 12333)Branding: Phase 2- Update Geyser Product Metadata Service to include Branding Discipline

comments.comment: Contact Dick before picking this story up please
This can be tested in Editorial QA now and in Production as of 11/8

item.title: [NG-12660] Support Superscripts/Subscripts and Special Characters in TinyMCE Editor for Inline TextBoxes
item.description:
as a production,vendor or superadmin user, I want to add superscripts or subscripts to a text box so I can add the note to the user

  • needed for Chemistry titles
  • here's the full list: http://www.tinymce.com/tryit/full.php

Acceptance Criteria

  • include superscripts/subscripts options in the text editor TinyMCE editor
  • include the special character option in the text editor TinyMCE editor
  • need to support adding these characters and rendering them in Reader
  • add and edit text boxes

item.summary: Support Superscripts/Subscripts and Special Characters in TinyMCE Editor for Inline TextBoxes

comments.comment: Adding to 2.5 backlog for review and estimation
Another note: "search" works for superscripts/subscripts, but not for special characters. Is that something we want to correct as part of this story?

Test scenarios captured at below location:

https://pipeline.cengage.com/confluence/display/NG/NG-12660+-+Support+Superscripts+%2C+Subscripts+and+Special+Characters+in+TinyMCE+Editor+for+Inline+TextBoxes

Tested all the scenarios on following OS/Browser combinations:

Mac OS - FF/Chrome/Safari - Everything looks good.

Win 7 - FF/Chrome/IE8 - everything looks good.

Noticed one scenario on rendering of the text box in IE9 that had a issue. steps to reproduce:

1) Login as a super admin or vendor or prod user and launch any title.
2) Navigate to a RA and add the inline text box ( with any content - special characters, superscripts etc).
3) Now via LPN navigate to another chapter, scroll few pages in the newly navigated chapter
4) Now go back to the RA where inline text box was added via LPN and TOC

Actual result: Inline text box is missing.
Expected result : Inline text box added must be present.

This scenario is also hit when we look up for existing inline text boxes after navigation and return.

Discussed with the developer Greg and re-opening the story.

The IE9 issue above doesn't appear to have anything to do with TinyMCE or superscripts/subscripts. We were able to reproduce it with a simply inline text box containing regular text. Also, note that you'll need to create the text box in a different browser, since adding inline annotations does not appear to be possible within IE9. Once created, go back to IE9 and navigate as Soumya describes.
this should not have been re-opened. The bug found, with an unknown cause, is not related to tinyMCE at all.

item.title: [NG-12731] Enlargeable Tables: Some Tables change their column width in main Reader and in Enlarged View
item.description:

Note: once one Table is enlarged, all other Tables (and this one when re-enlarged) are displayed with wide column width in main Reader and in Enlarged View.

Pre-testing (screen shot 1):
1. Navigate to Ch 13-4 and observe Table 8.4 in main Reader and in EV paying attention to column width.
2. Refresh the page, navigate to Ch 13-2a and observe Table 4.1 in main Reader and in EV paying attention to column width.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Navigate to Chapter 13, section 13-4 and observe Table 8.4 in main Reader, enlarge the table -> Table is displayed properly.
2. Linearly (using back navigation button) navigate to 13-2a, observe the Table 4.1 in main Reader (or Table 4.4 and unnumbered at the bottom).

Expected result: column width should not be changed.

Actual result: columns are displayed wider - screen shot 2.

3. Enlarge the Table.

Actual result: columns are displayed wider - screen shot 3.

NOTE: found 2 tables with truncated content in Enlarged View: unnumbered Table at the bottom in 13-2a and Table 5-4 in 13-4. (screen shots 4 and 5). To reproduce enlarge Table 8.4 in 13-4, navigate 3 pages away and come back to the page, observe Table 5-4 (has wider columns) and enlarge the Table -right side is cut off.

Similar behavior was noticed in Ehrlich (Tables on Introduction page and in Abbreviation section) - please see MTQA-16043 (note: logged against dev.mt, partially reproducible in production).

Dick - need your help in determining the functional impact for this issue.

When we go to pulling to a snapshot instead of pushing to all snapshots of a master we will need to have this data for the snapshot. We already have the columns in the database - they just do not get filled during a push.

It would be simpler to push the data than to go to the master to get it - the latter would involve either joining to get the master's data, or doing another call to get it, and doing some if/then stuff to populate the data sent to the client side. much simpler to just push it.

I spent about 4 hours to evaluate and code up including the snapshot data in a push. The code is ripe for another day's worth of refactoring to clean up the original push code some more, but if you pull the branch I created (NG-12814) you can see it in action.
We can play this - call it 2 points because I haven't thought about the testing too much and it might be extensive.
Ohh - pushing from a master like the Ehrlich on QAE with 1k+ snapshots might run into timeout problems....

Sounds like we should go to the master unless it turns out to be an observable performance problem. The data duplication and clear performance issues of doing it during the push suggest that's not the best approach.

Dick and Greg, question for you on this:

* I see the discipline values now populated for the old and new snapshot fine BUT
* In db do not see the value populated on old snapshots, it is there for new snapshots fine.
So question is why it is not populated and again where is this coming from?

On QAD running the query below get the Snapshots that do not have value populated for Branding_Discipline

WHERE PARENT_ID = 311

Snapshot id for example = 3034

See the value displays fine, how come the value is not in the db?
we opted to use the data in the master for the snapshots, so you will not find that in the snapshot for now. If we go to a pull model we will have to revisit this.

Based on discussion with Dick, existing snapshots will not have this data populated upon Refresh as I was expecting.
So in our db we will have existing Snapshots with this missing values.
We basically now look if the Master Snapshot and if data is there it displays on all linked Snapshots.
Closing this issue - as the new and old Snapshots are displaying the discipline info fine now - being tested as part of other stories as well.

item.title: [NG-12930] Simple mechanism for provisioning an app automatically to all snapshots
item.description:
Here's a simple mechanism for provisioning an app (once deployed to an environment) to all snapshots on that environment:

insert ignore into APP_PROVISION
(APP_ID, SNAPSHOT_ID, VERSION, CREATED_DATE, CREATED_BY, LAST_MODIFIED_DATE, LAST_MODIFIED_BY)
select
a.ID as appId,
s.ID as snapshotId,
1 as version,
UNIX_TIMESTAMP() * 1000 as createdDate,
1 as createdBy,
UNIX_TIMESTAMP() * 1000 as modifiedDate,
1 as lastModifiedBy
from APP a join SNAPSHOT s where 1=1 and
a.NAME='Cengage.Bookmarks';

This is SQL which needs to be run against the MySQL db for the environment to be updated. There doesn't appear to be a need to roll the servers for this to take effect (I refreshed my browser only and it picked up the new app in my snapshot).

Caveat is that this won't fire any of the appification lifecycle events for each snapshot, so this shouldn't be used for any apps which require / utilize those events.

AC's
cannot create duplicate apps in any snapshot (incl. master) if the App has already been provisioned
item.summary: Simple mechanism for provisioning an app automatically to all snapshots

comments.comment:
Only concern is whether there is server/memcache issues with doing a dbupdate directly - so we should discuss.
See : NG-10942 and NG-12729

If we can, with this story, differentiate between pushing to all Course modes and all Reader modes, that would be super-awesome.

We could perhaps then use this for the Web Links app?

New script created in nbcore-webapp/content: provision_app.sh

jstehler@MABOSJSTEHLE-M1:~/source/ng-nbcore/nbcore-webapp/content $ ./provision_app.sh
8 arguments required (host, user, pass, dbhost, dbuser, dbpass, appName, all|courseMode|readerMode), 0 provided

Example usage:

./provision_app.sh localhost superadmin 'neXtBook$2011' localhost root password Cengage.Bookmarks readerMode

Output:

***********************************************************************
Using SQL: select a.ID as appId, s.ID as snapshotId, n.NAME as snapshotName from APP a join SNAPSHOT s on 1=1 join NODE n on s.ID=n.SNAPSHOT_ID where n.NODE_TYPE='com.cengage.nextbook.NextBook' and a.NAME='Cengage.Bookmarks' and s.IS_READER_ONLY=true
***********************************************************************


Provisioning appId 18 (Cengage.Bookmarks) to snapshotId 8 (New Book 9780495807988)...

{"uid":18,"id":18,"name":"Cengage.Bookmarks","displayName":"Bookmarks","appVersion":"1.0","creator":"Cengage Learning","rootURI":"\/static\/nbapps\/bookmarks","helpURI":"\/static\/nbapps\/bookmarks\/help.html","provisionType":"mandatory","deployMode":"both","authScheme":"NONE","createdDate":1353513165371,"createdBy":1,"modifiedDate":1353513165630,"modifiedBy":1,"supportReactivate":false,"sharedSecret":false,"categories":["My Notes"]}

Have verified the following :

- Running this for courseMode, readerMode, or all provisions the app to the appropriate snapshots.
- Provisioning the app to a snaphot to which it's already been provisioned has no ill-effects (note that this was not tested on any apps that subscribe to lifecycle events - and should probably not be used on any such apps).

I'll pull together a report of the current state of apps vs. snapshots in production so we can determine what we want to do about other apps....but I tested provisioning the following in QAE and it worked fine - but it took a while b/c of the # of snaphsots. So if we were to do some of these older apps in production - we may want to tweak the script to only provision to apps that don't yet have it (script isn't currently designed for that - but it wouldn't be too much work).

Bookmarks: All Reader and Course Mode Masters and Snapshots
WebLinks: All Course Mode Masters and Snapshots

Ensure That Existing Apps Added This Year Are Present in Appropriate Snapshots and Masters
WebVideo: All Course Mode Masters and Snapshots
Evernote: All Reader and Course Mode Masters and Snapshots
Kaltura: All Course Mode Masters and Snapshots
Google Doc: All Course Mode Masters and Snapshots

item.title: [NG-12964] (Ref: Tech support ticket KYTS-4019)> SSO ISBN 9781111644475 > Unit 3 > 3.2 > After reading a text having GT in it, Compatibility mode on IE9 automatically turns on and Alert is shown while navigating Reader.
item.description:
(Ref: Tech support ticket KYTS-4019)> SSO ISBN 9781111644475 > Unit 3: Refrigeration and Refrigerants > 3.2 Refrigeration > After reading a text having Glossary Term in it, Compatibility mode on IE9 automatically turns on and Alert is shown while navigating Reader.

Important Notes:
1. This ticket is being logged in reference to Customer Reported KYTS ticket (KYTS-4019)
2. Please see attached video <<CompatibilityAlert.avi>> file in which compatibility mode in IE9 automatically turning on – user selects a text having Glossary Term and reads it. Once text reading is complete - navigating to next page using Next Button is automatically turning on the Compatibility Mode.
3. This issue is applicable to all titles.

Steps to Reproduce:
Step 1. Login into MindTap production environment i.e. http://mindtap.cengage.com/static/nb/login.html by using valid Uid/password.
Step 2. Search for SSO ISBN: 9781111644475
Step 3. Launch the title “Whitman_Refrigeration and Air Conditioning Technology_7e_RM”
Step 4. Click on “Theory of Heat” and open “Unit 3: Refrigeration and Refrigerants”
Step 5. Navigate to “3.2 Refrigeration”.
Step 6. Select the text containing the glossary term and read the text from context menu.
Step 7. After the complete text is read - click the next page

Actual Result: Compatibility mode automatically turns on and Alert is shown.

Expected Result: User is successfully able to navigate pages in IE9 without being shown compatibility alert due to automatic turn on of compatibility Mode.
item.summary: (Ref: Tech support ticket KYTS-4019)> SSO ISBN 9781111644475 > Unit 3 > 3.2 > After reading a text having GT in it, Compatibility mode on IE9 automatically turns on and Alert is shown while navigating Reader.

comments.comment: Nischal - can you see if you can reproduce this and if so, show it to the devs and see if they have any thoughts on how this could occur?

Hi Jeff,

I have verified this issue on the WIN7/IE9 and WIN XP/IE8 but this issue is not reproducible, next page navigates without showing compatibility mode alert/error.

Moreover RS is reading the GT definition,locked a Separate bug NG-12989.

Please let me know if you required any more information about this.

Thanks!
-Nischal
Got an update from Pinky - She could not reproduce this as well. Compatibility mode switch was not seen.

We further investigated this issue to try finding the root cause of it.

We observed that the issue is reproducible on Production Environment in Win7 64 Bit machines/IE9 machines whereas on 32 Bit Win 7/IE9 – it is working fine.

On Win 7 64 Bit with IE 9 - if we navigate the page after RS reads out the text including the Glossary terms definition in it – the Compatibility Mode automatically turns on.

Additionally, on QAE as RS reading the GT definitions along with the selected text is resolved. The issue is not getting reproduced on QAE accessed using Win 7 64 Bit / IE9
This appears to have been resolved in 2.5. Closing

item.summary: Regression: Nullpointer exception on Masters page

comments.comment: This is possibly related to NG-11447?

Determined that this is caused by corrupt data. In pre-prod environment there are few component status records with null status. As there is no use case that should cause it to be null the decision has been to

1. Update null status to ERROR status
2. Create NOT NULL constraint on the column

Production had such a data anomaly but on a test snapshot. That record has been deleted.
this is being investigated further on approach if we want to continue with this constraint please assign back once other issues are resolved.)
Loooks good - have not seen any null pointers...

item.title: [NG-13043] When first launching into reader - cannot create bookmark until navigating at least 1 page in reader
item.description:
Upon initial launch into the Mindtap reader - you cannot add a bookmark on the first section you land on in the reader.

Produces the following error :

Timestamp: 12/3/12 4:03:57 PM
Error: TypeError: Clui.appContext.currentContentId is undefined
Source File: http://editorial.ng.cengage.com/static/nbapps/bookmarks/provider/bookmarks.js
Line: 60

As soon as you navigate 1 page and back - you can add a bookmark.

NOTE - you see the same behavior if you refresh your browser while in the reader.

To reproduce :

1. Open the reader for any title that has the bookmark app provisioned
2. Attempt to bookmark (without navigating)

Observed behavior - bookmark fails to get created and the above error is displayed in error console.
item.summary: When first launching into reader - cannot create bookmark until navigating at least 1 page in reader

comments.comment: Let me know if this is not a low risk fix

Seems low risk; the content_view plugin is responsible for setting the currentContentId object, and does that on changes to the page attribute in the reading object. We are updating that attribute before initializing the content_view plugin, so it could be as easy as moving that attribute set operation until right after that initialization.
Moved setting of initial page in reading model object to after init of reader components

Verified on latest QAE build that now user is allowed to Bookmark on very 1st page.

- Vinay
Fix broken on latest QAE build...
added fix to init bookmark button state on reader contentChange event

Verified on QAE Environment
Launching directly to A-Head , B-head and directly opening RA (Chapter contents) then Bookmarking the page is working OK
Closing out the Ticket.

item.title: [NG-13069] CNow Homework App> Instructor end> Link an assignment on LPN without setting due date> System does not immediately update the due date of assignment on LPN which is similar to due date of the course.
item.description:
**Issue is reproducible on Classtest server(v07.0174) on using the SSO instructor account.
**Issue is reproducible for all valid user roles on Appdev.
**Issue is reproducible on QAF/QA3 server(v07.0147.12) on using the SSO instructor account.
**Issue is reproducible for all valid user roles on QAF.

Prerequisite:
Instructor(inst90_mindapp@qai.com/A123456) has created an assignment(Assign_HW) inside a MinTap course(SafariCheck_04/12 ).

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch the URL: http://s-login.cengage.com/cb/login.htm
2. Login with valid instructor credentials: inst90_mindapp@qai.com/A123456
3. Click on course link(SafariCheck_04/12) and verify that system navigates to MindTap end.
4. Open 'Add Activity' tool and link an assignment(Assign_HW) to LPN without setting any due date of assignment.

Actual Result:
Immediately after linking an assignment, System just updates 'No Submissions' and 'Counts Towards Grading' tag on LPN. Please refer to attached screenshot <<Assignment_info.jpg>>.

Observation:

  • Logout and login or on refreshing the page, system correctly updates the due date of the assignment.

Expected Result:
System should also immediately update due date of the assignment which is same as due date of the course.
item.summary: CNow Homework App> Instructor end> Link an assignment on LPN without setting due date> System does not immediately update the due date of assignment on LPN which is similar to due date of the course.

comments.comment: This could be possibliy fixed with NG-11544.
Seems like a dupe of NG-11544.
Priyanka - can you retest this on AppDev after a new build is deployed there. We think this may be resolved w/ the fix for NG-11544.

Abhishek -can you have someone test this out on App Dev after today's deployment?

thanks

System immediately updates the end date of the snapshot course as 'Due Date' if user doesn't set a specific due date for the activity.

QA verified the observation for both Distinct and Inline Activities.
Refer to attached file<<Due_Date.zip>>for reference.

item.title: [NG-13084] REGRESSION: Broken navigation - TOC is displayed - when switch Chapters via Notepad or Clicking on cross-ref link to a target in another Chapter
item.description:
Reproducible in non-math books.

Case 1: switching Chapters via Notepad:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Launch any MT (Pride - non-math - was taken for description).
2. Create user Annotations (HL and/or QN) in different Chapters, e.g., 1, 2, 3.
3. Open Notepad and navigate to Annotations associated to another Chapter.

Expected result: section with Annotations is displayed (ideally page should be scrolled to the location of Annotations).

Actual result: TOC is displayed.

Case 2: navigating to a target displayed in another Chapter"
1. Open Uberdoc: Chapter 1, section 1.1 click link to Figure 2.1 (displayed in Chapter 2).

Expected result: Full Book opens section 2-1a scrolled to the location of Figure 2.1.

Actual result: Full Book open Chapter 2 TOC.
item.summary: REGRESSION: Broken navigation - TOC is displayed - when switch Chapters via Notepad or Clicking on cross-ref link to a target in another Chapter

comments.comment: Possibly related to NG-12904.
Asking Jared for some help on this one. It seems to be unrelated to mobile work, but I don't know enough about the code to quickly determine where the section should be correctly handled.
fixed along with commit for NG-13083

Verified on QAE: corresponding page is displayed when switch Chapters via Notepad or clicking on cross-ref link to a target in another Chapter.
The issue when main Reader is switching to TOC at the same time when Full Book is opening after clicking on cross-ref link is tracked separately in NG-13098.
Closed.

item.title: [NG-13091] AA: Progress App - when editing overall score, lpn does not refresh
item.description:
The assignment only has one student take. Delete the student attempt. Verify the LPN displays no submissions. Now for that same student edit the score to 100% in the progress app. We see the score change in the progress app, however I do not see a change on the LPN.
Refreshing does not display the lpn changes as well.
item.summary: AA: Progress App - when editing overall score, lpn does not refresh

comments.comment:
The implementation was using the submission count, but in case of edited scores there is no submission count. Fix the logic, now if the class avg is not null we show the class Avg.

Claude, please review the changes
reviewed by Claude

item.title: [NG-13093] Comments: AA: Student does not see comments when instructor deletes the assignment thats is past due
item.description:
if an instructor deleted a past due assignment, we do not show a deleted comment in the LPN as a student.

Also, if the assignment is in the past, and the student has not submitted the assignment and the instructor has a comment the student does not see that currently. This is currently they way it behaves in production.

We want to now display all the comments for the student dispite the past due date.
item.summary: Comments: AA: Student does not see comments when instructor deletes the assignment thats is past due

comments.comment: Fix the code, Now the comment bubble is visible/accessible if there are comments .
Code reviewed by Vishal and Claude

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: The comments bubble was visible only when user have score, after due date.

item.title: [NG-13094] Regression: Math content disappears from the reader while navigating from Notepad
item.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

CASE 1:
1) Login in QAD and launch uberdoc
2) Create a HL on chapter 2.2a example 6:solution math content
3) Check the HL in the notepad - all good
4) Switch the RA to go to chapter 3 with notepad open in background.
5) Navigate to the HL now from the notepad ( due to NG-12904 it will lead you to chapter 2 TOC)
6) Navigate to 2.2a.

Actual: see the math is disappeared from the reader.
Expected: Math should be seen rendered.

CASE 2:
1) Login in QAD and launch uberdoc
2) Create a HL on chapter 2.2a example 6:solution math content
3) Check the HL in the notepad - all good
4) Go to the reader now and change the background color via the CM.
4) Switch the RA to go to chapter 3 with notepad open in background.
5) Navigate to the HL now from the notepad ( due to NG-12904 it will lead you to chapter 2 TOC)
6) Navigate to 2.2a.

Actual: see the math is disappeared from the reader.
Expected: Math should be seen rendered.
item.summary: Regression: Math content disappears from the reader while navigating from Notepad

comments.comment: Tested this on FF and chrome - looks good. Will continue to test on other browsers.

Verified this issue and observed that the issue is no more reproducible at our end as math content is displayed properly while navigating from Notepad.

Environment: QAE and QAD
Browser: FF,Chrome, IE9 and Safari

attachment.name: QAD_Math disappearing on reader_2012-12-05 at 12.34.47 PM.png
attachment.author: soumya.thyagarajan

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Event handlers were being attached to Viewer multiple times. This was causing annotations to be rendered multiple times (and simultaniouslty)

item.title: [NG-13098] Regression: Clicking on cross-ref link to another Chapter or a target in the same/another Chapter makes main Reader switch to TOC
item.description:
Reproducible when clicking on all links which are opening Full Book (link to Chapter, link to a target in the same Chapter in another section, link to a target in another Chapter, link to a specific content).

Steps to reproduce when link to a target in another Chapter is clicked:
1. Launch Uberdoc, open Chapter 1, section 1.1.
2. Scroll almost to the bottom and click link to Figure 2.1 (displayed in Chapter 2).

Expected result: Reader stays on the same page while Full Book opens section 2-1a scrolled to the location of Figure 2.1.

Actual result: main Reader switches to TOC at the time Full Book is opening.

Ehrlich examples: e.g., Chapter 10:
10-2c - link to Chapter 4;
10-2g - link to Figure 10.2 located in 10-2d (same Chapter in another section).
item.summary: Regression: Clicking on cross-ref link to another Chapter or a target in the same/another Chapter makes main Reader switch to TOC

comments.comment: A fix committed for NG-13017 caused this regression: https://github.com/CengageEng/ng-ui/commit/c24d6be2724b8618beae4ac8bc0ed313d8bf2391
Reverted the commit so this issue should be fixed now. NG-13017 need some expertise in reader, So Jared/Dick will fix that.
Ajay set this in progress. Ajay, I assume you're working on this, so I'm assigning it to you.
Moving directly to QA, since the code that caused this regression has been reverted.
Reverting the commit(https://github.com/CengageEng/ng-ui/commit/c24d6be2724b8618beae4ac8bc0ed313d8bf2391) for NG-13017 fix have resolved this issue. Please verify !
Please have someone test this thoroughly.

Verified this issue on QAE and found that clicking on cross-ref link to another Chapter or a target in the same/another Chapter are working as expected and not switch reader to TOC.
Hence closing this issue.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Fix for NG-13017

item.title: [NG-13181] Regression: IE9: User Annotations: Quick Notes: Cannot be Edited/Deleted after being edited several times/New cannot be created
item.description:
Not in production 2.4.
Reproducible in IE9 on QAE/QAF.

Steps to reproduce:
Case 1:
1. Launch any MT, open any RA, navigate to any regular page.
2. Select text, from CM click Add Note, type and Save -> QN color and MM are displayed on the page.
3. Navigate 2+ pages away and back to the page and click on MM, click Edit -> this time Edit button is working, type, click Save and Done.
4. Navigate 2+ pages away and back to the page, click on MM, click on any button in QN window.

Expected result: Edit/Delete/Done buttons are working.

Actual result: buttons are not clickable.

Case 2:
1. Create QN, click on MM, click Edit, type, Save, do not click Done, click Edit again, type, click Save, click Done.
2. Click on MM again and click Edit - not working.

Case 3:
1. Create QN, click on MM immediately after creation, click Edit, type, click Save and Done.
2. Click on MM again and click on Edit or Delete - not working. (Note: if Edit button works, then edit some text, click Save and Done and click on MM again).

Case 4:
1. Create QN.
2. Click on MM, edit text, click Save, Done. Repeat one more time.
3. Navigate 2+ pages, select text, from CM click Add Note, type and click Save - not working.

Note: there are more cases...
item.summary: Regression: IE9: User Annotations: Quick Notes: Cannot be Edited/Deleted after being edited several times/New cannot be created

comments.comment:
I was able to reproduce with the below steps on IE9:

1) Create a QN
2) Navigate away to another chapter via LPN
3) Return to the chapter where QN was created via LPN and via TOC go to particular section.
4) Try to edit the MM - it was not working.

* I am able to reproduce this on IE9 with just one edit and navigate couple of pages and back and edit doesn't work.
* Once user gets into this state they cannot add any other quick note on other pages in the same chapter and another chapter also.
* Logout and login again back in business.
* Right no do not see impact on preventing user from the highlighting, just another note cannot be added.


--------
Console errors below right when you launch the reading - not sure related but adding them in here for reference.

speaker.js, line 849 character 4
SCRIPT5007: Unable to get value of the property 'parentNode': object is null or undefined
speaker.js, line 849 character 4
SCRIPT5007: Unable to get value of the property 'parentNode': object is null or undefined
speaker.js, line 849 character 4
SCRIPT5007: Unable to get value of the property 'parentNode': object is null or undefined
speaker.js, line 849 character 4
Need to characterize a bit more and review to identify possible root cause.
Also, observed that unable to create anymore notes ones user gets to this state. Seems it starts working again only after refresh/reload page.

Possible the below results of testing will help (tested on QAE and QAF):
Seems ReadSpeaker app provisioned makes QN stop working (i unprovosoned it and QN were working, then provisioned again - QN stopped working).
 Also, when notification is enabled there is an error on every navigation click:
Webpage error details

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 7.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; BOIE9;ENUS)
Timestamp: Wed, 12 Dec 2012 19:51:53 UTC


Message: Unable to get value of the property 'parentNode': object is null or undefined
Line: 849
Char: 4
Code: 0
URI: http://qaf.ng.cengage.com/static/iloveapps/readspeaker/jslib/speaker.js

This issue is not reproducible in 2.5 build #3 but is reproducible in build #6. Iryna verified that it's related to the readspeaker app. It's likely this was introduced with the readspeaker changes for either NG-13055 or NG-13131 on Tuesday.

The issue is from NG-13131. Line 861: rs.popup.player_y_pos = selobj.anchorNode.parentNode.offsetTop;

Assigning to Taylor to come up with an appropriate strategy here.

With the latest build deployed to QAF - here is the error now in the console on IE9 which happens after adding a note and navigating to next page.

SCRIPT16389: Unspecified error.
speaker.js, line 857 character 5

I've reverted the changes made to speaker.js over the past week and the error in IE is no longer present. I've assigned the bug to Greg because there is now another error coming up in RangyCore, a range selection third-party piece of code.

I can't reproduce the particular bug that Taylor mentions in his screenshot. However, I have witnessed a different bug in Rangy that results in the highlight being incorrectly placed on IE9. This only happens when you remove a quicknote and then reselect text on the page. This doesn't seem like a show-stopper to me, but we are diving into the Rangy code to see what it is doing wrong.
Code has been reverted. Sending straight to QA. Opened NG-13224 to track the re-selection bug discovered while testing this one.
Verified all the scenarios that are mentioned in the bug on QAF environment and found it to be fixed, hence we closed this ticket.

item.title: [NG-13186] Regression: inline AA - launching into the second inline activity does not display the submit activity button
item.description:
QAF:

Steps to reproduce:

userone@ng.com/password. Login via the olr (s-login.cengage.com).
Click on QAFSumbit Book

Once on the LPN:

  • click on Chapter 2: The Human Body in Health and Disease(DO NOT EDIT) (Third node under LPN)
  • Toggle between "Quick Check 2.1 Spelling Bee" inline activity Under "Anatomic Reference Systems" reading activity and "Quick Check 2.3 Spelling Bee" inline activity under "Structures of the Body" reading activity

Basically toggle between one inline activity in a reading activity to another inline activity in a different reading causing Submit Activity button disappear.

Happens in all browsers.

Error from FF console (inline_aa_controller.js line # 29)
self.options.model is undefined
if (self.options.model.id == data.activityId){

We noticed a bunch of calls to the activity.launch.take event pub, some resolving to not properly populated object instances (no model). As we navigate around, the # of callback on the same page increases, so we think it might be caused by not removing subscription to that event when an annotation gets out of scope, then leading to the JS error as the called back object no more represents a valid on page annotation.

Possibly using the new way of subscribing would help (by delegating to the controller the role of cleaning up?)
'activity.launch.take hubsub': function(ev, data){

Also checking for model being valid and yielding if not might be a safe extra guard.
item.summary: Regression: inline AA - launching into the second inline activity does not display the submit activity button

comments.comment: Diff of the changes wrt to release-2.5 branch. Also committed the same under NG-13186 branch from release-2.5.

The sub was not unsubscribing listeners when the page with annotation was navigated away. Launching a take was thus sending an event that many listeners of no more on page AA annotations were receiving. It usually did not cause any issue, but for some reason some of those now-gone controllers where failing on the callback, preventing subsequent listeners to handle the event. If the annotation for which the event was really intended happened to be after the corrupted listener, it would not receive the callback and the submit button would not show up.

Fixed by using the new hubsub event model that delegates the unsubscribing logic to the controller. And some hardening of the code if the controller is a corrupt state when call back occurs.
Verified on qaf.
